campaign.story:
Antarktikos is a printed magazine, published once a year. This annual journal combines artistic and scientific exploration within the awe-inspiring and thought-provoking context of Antarctica.

Founder
My name is Esther Kokmeijer and I am the editor, creative director and graphic designer of ANTARKTIKOS magazine. Since 2013, I have been seasonally working as a guide and expedition photographer in the Arctic and Antarctic.

Antarctica is the last great untouched wilderness, and there is not a more merciless place on Earth. The landscape is of such incredible and unparalleled beauty and being immersed in it fosters an extraordinary sense of wonder.

For a long time, I have wanted to publish a magazine dedicated to Antarctica. That dream is about to come true. I believe in the effectiveness and potency of combining art and science and in the potential for gaining new insights by compiling many ideas around one theme.

Creating this magazine in collaboration with many artists and scientists provides me with the opportunity to research how art and science can reinforce each other.

My work has been widely exhibited and published worldwide. For various projects, I have visited 84 countries. Furthermore, I participated in long term art residency programmes in The Netherlands, Indonesia, South Korea, Greenland, Antarctica, Spitsbergen, Germany, France, Mongolia, and China. For more info about my works you can have a look on my website. www.estherkokmeijer.nl / www.facebook.com/estherkokmeijer
Antarctic Sound, Antarctica (photo: Yanina El Kassisse)
Why
The vast continent of Antarctica is an isolated location whose harsh conditions and heavenly natural serenity have long appealed to the imagination. However, the remaining opportunities for this untouched no man’s land are not without responsibility.

Since the signing of the 1959 Antarctic Treaty, Antarctica has been a scientific reserve for peaceful purposes, scientific investigation and environmental protection. The continent covers 14 million square kilometres, 5.4 million square miles, and has no native human population or weapons and remains under no right of ownership. Despite Antarctica belonging to no one, and thus to us all, the continent plays a significant role, at many levels, on the world stage. Antarctica could be seen as the main protagonist in the issues and challenges facing the contemporary world.

Very few people have the opportunity of visiting Antarctica – a limitation necessary for Antarctica’s preservation. This magazine’s goal is to allow those for whom Antarctica remains inaccessible to experience its richness and magic. For the roughly 75,000 people a year that travel to Antarctica, the ANTARKTIKOS journal will provide substantive background information that will support in making the visitors into ambassadors for the protection of Antarctica and our worldwide environment.

Antarktikos: Where art meets science meets art
ANTARKTIKOS combines art and science to engage with the challenges and inspiration Antarctica presents. In many respects, scientists and artists share an immaterial and mental ownership of Antarctica. They are not interested in conquering or ownership. Instead, they temporarily engage with the continent to bring knowledge, ideas, inspiration, confusion, beauty and acutely urgent questions to the world.

ANTARKTIKOS is aimed at professionals in the field, scientists studying Antarctica and artists and scientists whose research is related to the kinds of environmental questions that Antarctica proposes. The journal intends to inspire international science-based collaboration. Specifically, it aims to encourage partnerships between art and science.
///

Content
ANTARKTIKOS will be the first independent and international magazine entirely dedicated to Antarctica. The first printed issue is expected in Autumn 2021.

Each issue of ANTARKTIKOS is preceded by an open call for a broad range of subjects from diverse disciplines. The theme of the first issue of ANTARKTIKOS is Mapping Nature.

Prospective contributors, including scientists, artists, designers, architects, academics, activists, cities, universities, public institutions, companies, and social organizations, are invited to apply and submit their definite proposal.

Submissions can be any kind of research, story, or visualization related to the mapping of Antarctica. From ice cores containing the information trapped in 20,000-year-old air bubbles, to the architectural drawing of research stations, to imaginary maps of Antarctica in the year 3000.
Climate Archive - Suzette Bousema (Ice cores, Antarctica, approx. 20,000 years old)
https://www.antarktikos.com/Open-Call-1
The open call deadline is 21 June 2021

Next to all kind of content in all kind of forms an essential part of ANTARKTIKOS is the appendix of scientific papers.

The magazine is published using high-quality, sustainable offset printing on FSC®-certified paper with biodegradable ink. We use plastic free packaging for shipping.

The open call process and subsequent design of the magazine are still in progress. We promise that the magazine and design, like Antarctica, will be awe-inspiring.
Adele Jackson. Antarctic Colour Swatch, 2014. The Antarctic Circles sculptural book series. © the artist, Adele Jackson. Reproduced with permission.
///

Be part of the adventure
The first issue will be mostly pre-purchased magazines. To ensure you get the first issue of ANTARKTIKOS, please place your order in advance.

We count on that for next year Antarctica lovers will find us. But for this first year, we could use your help in spreading the word and reach everyone interested in Antarctica.

If you are interested in Antarctica, art and science, environmental issues, world wide contemporary challenges or anything related to the topic of Mapping Nature, we also invite you to support this project and become an ANTARKTIKOS friend.

ANTARKTIKOS friends come in different varieties
Brash Ice (photo: Esther Kokmeijer)
Brash Ice friends - Crowdfunding backers 1 (see rewards
Brash ice is an accumulation of floating ice made up of fragments no more than two metres (5.6 ft) across.

///
Pack Ice (photo: Esther Kokmeijer)
Pack Ice friends - Crowdfunding backers 2 (see rewards)
Pack ice is made up of ice fragments frozen together into a solid body.

///
Growler (photo: Esther Kokmeijer)
Growlers friends - crew, staff and contributors
A growler is less than 1 metre (3.3 ft) high and 5 metres (16 ft) long.

///
Bergy Bit (photo: Esther Kokmeijer)
Bergy Bits friends (ambassadors)
Bergy Bits are small icebergs that rise between one to four metres (3–13 ft) above sea level.

///
Iceberg (photo: Esther Kokmeijer)
Icebergs friends (institutions and associations)
To be classified as an iceberg, the ice must be more than five metres (16 ft) above sea level.

To show our appreciation, all ANTARKTIKOS friends are mentioned in the magazine. You are mentioned by your full name or a name of your choice. Please let us know later how you would like to be mentioned in the magazine, when providing your address.

///

Rewards

Pledge €15 or more for ANTARKTIKOS magazine (digital version)
Pledge €15 or more for ANTARKTIKOS magazine
Pledge €22 or more for ANTARKTIKOS magazine + pin
Pledge €25 or more for ANTARKTIKOS magazine + patch
Pledge €30 or more for 2 ANTARKTIKOS magazines
Pledge €40 or more for ANTARKTIKOS magazine + bag and pin
Pledge €55 or more for 3 ANTARKTIKOS magazines + patch and pin
Pledge €150 or more for 10 ANTARKTIKOS magazines + bag, patch and pin
Pledge €350 or more for Special edition of Terra Nullius. + ANTARKTIKOS magazine, bag, patch and pin.
ANTARKTIKOS pin (enamel 20 mm)
///
ANTARKTIKOS patch to iron on your own bag, jacket or other clothes. (embroidered 80 mm)
ANTARKTIKOS patch to iron on your own bag, jacket or other clothes. (embroidered 80 mm)
 ///
ANTARKTIKOS tote bag
 ///

Terra Nullius, Ownership and Pioneering on Ice - Esther Kokmeijer
Terra Nullius, Ownership and Pioneering on Ice (detail) - Esther Kokmeijer
Terra Nullius, Ownership and Pioneering on Ice (detail) - Esther Kokmeijer
Terra Nullius, Ownership and Pioneering on Ice (detail) - Esther Kokmeijer
///

Project Planning
1 December 2020 (International Antarctica Day) – Launch of open call
21 December 2020 (Solstice) – Launch Kickstarter crowd funding and media campaign.
21 June 2021 (Solstice) – Deadline of open call
July 2021 through October 2021 – Production, printing and distribution of the magazine
October and November 2021 – Supporters receive magazines and other rewards
01 December 2021 (International Antarctica Day) – Special event to celebrate the first issue + open call for ANTARKTIKOS Magazine #2
Base Esperanza, Antarctica (photo: Esther Kokmeijer)
///

Thank you for your support.
Thank you for reading and we hope you become a part of this wonderful adventure.

Please help spread the word and find ANTARKTIKOS on social media:
www.facebook.com/AntarktikosMagazine
www.instagram.com/antarktikosmagazine
mail@antarktikos.com
Gentoo Penguins, Cuverville Antarctica (photo: Esther Kokmeijer)
///

 “The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.” 
Aristotle (384–322 BC)

Over 2000 years ago, Greek philosophers imagined the existence of a continent at the South Pole. The ancient Greeks wrote about a large landmass at the globe’s southern tip, assuming it existed despite having never seen it. Aristotle theorized that this southern land allowed the spherical Earth to maintain a geophysical balance with the northern lands. Hence he called it Antarktikos. Arktikos is ancient Greek for ‘near the Bear’, referring to the Great Bear constellation in the northern celestial hemisphere. Thus Antarktikos means contra to the Bear or opposite the north.

///
www.antarktikos.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
ANTARKTIKOS magazine will definitely get there. The quantity plays no role in this endeavour, but the more pre-purchases we receive, the more we can invest in the magazine to make it bigger, better and bolder.

We shall do our very best to have the magazine ready before the Antarctic travel season starts in autumn 2021. If there are any delays to our schedule, we shall immediately notify you.

If this Kickstarter is successful, we should like to spread the wealth Antarctica has to offer. If we raise €20,000, we shall donate 50 magazines to art and science faculties at universities to give students free access to the magazine. For every subsequent €10,000 raised, we shall donate another 50 magazines.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Finally, the complete Alan Moore masterpiece in one 480 page tome - the PROVIDENCE COMPENDIUM!  Providence is Alan Moore’s quintessential horror series! In it, he weaves and reinvents the works of H.P. Lovecraft through historical events. It is both a sequel and prequel to Neonomicon.   Just to make it more tasty, we have a Nightmares of Providence art book to go with it!  This is a special opportunity to support the PROVIDENCE COMPENDIUM that is scheduled for release in March 2021, and we have some killer limited edition set options as well!  With your support, we can get this astounding work back in print!
The PROVIDENCE COMPENDIUM is the complete series, all twelve issues by Alan Moore and Jacen Burrows, in one 480 page volume.   There will be a paperback edition that will be available everywhere early summer 2021, but the Hardcover edition we are offering here will NOT be available on Amazon, etc.  Only direct from us and this Kickstarter!
Nightmares of Providence#1 is a 48 page B&W book featuring all-new art from a huge range of talent including Gabriel Andrade, Christian Zanier, Ivan Rodriguez, and featuring Daniel Gete!  Stretch goals will include added pages, so it may be much bigger by the end!
There are added ship costs on this campaign due to the extreme weight of these tomes.  You can see those exact costs based on your location when you pledge.   Thank you for your support!

Description:  LIMITED TO 75 SETS!!!  Behold, a vast array of unearthed treasures that would make Cthulhu's tentacles tremble! This set is all about the BLACK – in honor of Robert Black, we present NEONOMICON BLACK and PROVIDENCE BLACK. These special hardcover editions are each limited to just 75 copies for this set, and designed as a matching pair. And the last Alan Moore signed product we will have (the signature sheets are already in house). The Neonomicon Black is signed by Jacen Burrows and the Providence Black is signed by Alan Moore, Jacen Burrows and features an original sketch by Burrows as well! This set has ALL the covers of Nightmares of Providence but includes six that are exclusive to this set. The Black Leather by Christian Zanier, Black Lurking by Daniel Gete, Black Ghoulish by Renato Camilo, Black Abyss, and Black Destiny by Gabriel Andrade, and Black Domesticated by Zanier!
      That's not even close to everything! There is an original Daniel Gete 8 x 10 sketch that is part of the level below this as well, but here you also get the first time Ivan Rodriguez has ever done sketches, with an epic Lovecraftian horror piece done in gray washes! We unearthed some of the very first Neonomicon promo posters, and include both of those, signed by Burrows! The topper is a sixteen book gold seal Stella Sapiente set of all four Neonomicon issues (Book of the Dead covers) and all twelve of the single issues of Providence (regular cover), original first printing copies! Each of these sixteen issues has the Stella Sapeinte Gold Set affixed and limited to just 100 sets!
THREE BONUS BOOKS - Nightmares of Providence #1 Deep One cover is a bonus that is not part of the the lower levels on the Kickstarter. We will also offer a couple add-on books, the Royal Blue Leather and the Wraparound covers, but these are included with your set as a special thank you! 
     Your purchase of this set is a huge help to us, and we tried to make it a great value for you.  We profoundly appreciate your support!

                                                 *****************************
 FAQ:
Digital Delivery - Your digital items will be added and sent to you via email as a separate order when they are ready this winter. They will be delivered as PDF or CBZ files from the Comic Cavalcade digital store.  
Shipping costs – We have tried to reduce the shipping costs as much as we can, but these sets are VERY heavy!  The Hardcover books are 3 pounds each, so it all adds up quickly.  We will not sacrifice our world-renowned packing, so your order will get to you undamaged.  We do NOT make a profit on shipping, in fact we lose money on every shipment, so we do supplement the cost as much as we can.  But it still is an issue for International buyers.  Very sorry for the burden, and extra thanks for your support!
Release dates – Current plan is March to begin shipping, and it certainly will take some time to get all the orders processed.  Given the very unique state of the World, there certainly could be unexpected delays, but by planning for after the Holiday season, we're hoping things can run smoothly.

Any other questions please drop us a Direct Message!  Thank you so very much for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
These are very challenging times, so it is hard to see all the ways things could go wrong with publishing right now! However, the content has already been created, so what remains is the balance of the original sketches from Daniel Gete and Ivan Rodriguez, remastering the Digital editions, printing the issue and the Graphic Novel, and shipping all the Rewards. We are trying to build in plenty of time for all the weird issues that might pop up, hence our expected fill date of March/April 2021. The digital rewards will be sent out as soon as those files are remastered for digital format.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Ancient Elders move at their own pace! Quick update.
updates.update_content: Hello all, hope your 2021 has been going along swimmingly.  A quick update,  The Providence Compendium has not yet been released, the current schedule calls for late July publication. Until we have copies in hand, we aren't sure exactly when orders will begin shipping.  Even when than does start, we have many thousands of orders to process, so it is certainly not going to be an instant process once we begin, but you will be sent tracking information as soon as your package does get on the road.  Digital copies of Nightmares of Providence will start rolling out as that book is released, looks like end of June there.  We are trying to roughly match up digital release dates with print.

updates.update_userinfo: Print times are really slow, but proof of life! Cinema Purgatorio is printed!
updates.update_content: Howdy all, hope 2021 is going well for you.  Everything is crawling along, it is a very different world than it used to be for printing, so right now we're having trouble pinning down exact dates.  Our current estimate is May for shipping to begin, and we'll certainly update you again before then.  But we do have early copies of the Cinema Purgatorio collection in our hands right this second!  Several months later than we hoped, but hey, it is a light at the end of the tunnel!   If you added on a copy, it will ship with the rest of your Providence Compendium order.    If you still need a copy, it will be in comic stores in two weeks, or our store will start shipping copies THIS FRIDAY!

Hope you all are staying safe and warm, here in the Central USA we've been hammered the past few weeks with the worst winter weather.  Update on the status of things:
Surveys - surprisingly, there are still over a hundred folks that have not filled out their survey.  We need that information please so we can get orders entered with shipping addresses.  Much greater risk of error if we go back and try to pick up single changes later, so if you can, please let us know.  If you are having trouble filling out the survey, just send us a message with your address information, that works!

updates.update_userinfo: Speak Aklo to me, baby! The Elder Gods Rise!
updates.update_content: Well, what is there to say but we CRUSHED IT!  Your support was astounding and this was our largest fundraising campaign in the 25 year history of Avatar Press!  There aren't words to express how grateful we are that each and every one of you came together, in the most challenging year of a generation, to give us this kind of support.  We'll follow up in a couple weeks after everything is processed by Kickstarter to collect info via  surveys, but for now, our profound thanks to the greatest fans in this world...  or in Yuggoth!

updates.update_userinfo: Home stretch and sooooo close to Stretch Goal #2!
updates.update_content: We are into the final hours of what has been an epic campaign, thank you all!  We are still a few thousand short of Stretch Goal #2 so if there are any add-on items you have been chewing on, now would be a great time to add them!  Anything you need help with, please just send us a message, we are hoping to bring this home with a thunderous boom at the end!   Thanks again for all your support, it means the world to us.

updates.update_userinfo: We are going to need a bigger boat! Stretch Goal #2!
updates.update_content: Things are going great, and we are approaching the biggest Kickstarter fund raising total we've ever had!  We can't thank you all enough for the monumental outpouring of support and generous pledges!  Since we'd love for this to be the biggest of all-time, we need to really kill it with a new stretch.  So here we go - at $125,000 we add another entire Nightmares of Providence issue!  A digital-only 16 page book that will be sent to every single backer!  This BONUS TERRORS will have super-rare goodies from the past 15 years of Alan Moore projects.  Killer pieces seen unobscured by lettering or colors from Jacen Burrows, Matt Martin, Sebastian Fiumara, Juan Jose Ryp and more!  Topped off with all-new art from Daniel Gete!  Also below we are re-sending all the information about Add-On options, and are here to help if you have any questions.  It's pretty easy, just send us a Message with what you want and we'll help you get it!

Thanks for your patience as we get a dual-system going here.  Kickstarter has an add-on menu, which many people have used so far, thanks for all the support!  But we are aware mobile apps can't see it, nor can some browsers, so there are lots of goodies folks aren't aware of to date.  So our solution isn't as clean as their menu, but we can take care of everyone.  Any person can manually change the amount of their pledge.  So we can take your add-on order via PM, you can increase your pledge, and we will confirm.

campaign.story:
The front porch portrait series began as a way to both connect people and record history through this period of COVID-19 quarantine. The photos and the experience of being photographed give people a chance to participate in a larger cause, providing a feeling of togetherness within our community. We are both separate and together, simultaneously. The death of George Floyd, just nine blocks from my house, and the subsequent, ongoing demonstrations have intensified the desire for unity and highlighted the strength of solidarity.
Initially, participants for the series were located by placing notices for free portraits on Nextdoor and Facebook and reaching out to community leaders. The portraits were offered free of charge as a way to include everyone who was interested in participating. Identifying subjects for this project has now become self-sustaining as word has spread, and I have photographed more than 400 families and individuals, and “Porch Portraits” has been featured on Minnesota Public Radio, Art Hounds, and Fox 9’s Morning Buzz.
This book captures a collection of these portraits. It is an honor and privilege to be able to capture this history in real time and share it with you.
The Book
Minnesota Front Porch Portraits – Staying Apart Together will be an 8.5 x 11,” 100-page, hardbound book, and will include approximately 180 images printed on heavyweight, archival paper. It will have a registered ISBN. Book design is by Dan Woychick. The book will be printed locally to assure the best quality, and to invest back into the local community. The print run will be limited to 500 books, all of which will be signed and numbered. There will not be a second-printing.
BONUS: With each book sold, I will donate $2 of my own money to Twin Cities Rebuild For The Future. No funds raised through Kickstarter will be donated. 
About the Artist
Scott Streble is a Minneapolis-based photographer who uses photography to help people. He has spent 30 years working with non-profits and non-governmental agencies throughout the world. His clients include homeless shelters, food banks, relief organizations and those who work in affordable housing, health care, and education. He has worked with Doctors Without Borders, Habitat For Humanity, The United Way, American Red Cross, and more than 50 homeless shelters in the US and Canada. 
“Photos can help shine a light on both those who need help and their helpers. Images help organizations grow awareness, inspire donors, and encourage volunteerism. It pains me to see an organization without quality images to accurately represent the valuable work they are doing.”
Scott also has several ongoing personal projects: he photographs senior citizens, providing photos to families who might not otherwise have a current photo of their loved one, and also periodically takes free portraits for those who are unemployed or underemployed to use while they look for work. 
He has dedicated his career to using photography for good, to help others, since we are all in this together.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There aren’t many risks associated with this project, as the bulk of the work has been completed. If this project meets its funding goal, I expect the printed books to ship within 8-10 weeks of the end of this campaign. 

This project has been a labor of love, so it’s exciting to be close to having the collection published. Thank you for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Thanks to MSP Magazine and writer Julie Zerull for doing a piece about my photo project, "Front Porch Portraits" It's in their current issue.

Thanks to Minnpost and Jim Walsh for article about my project/book.
Jim did an excellent job describing the project and the motivation behind it.

Minnpost: ‘Front Porch Portraits’: Connecting community during a pandemic

All the Kickstarter books should have reached their destinations by now but I do have a limited number of additional copies available for purchase. "Front Porch Portraits" would make a unique holiday gift, especially for someone who has ties to the Twin Cities. 

Buy "Front Porch Portraits"

Yesterday, I witnessed,"Front Porch Portraits" being bound at Midwest Editions, which is just 2 miles from my house. I am lucky to have such great local vendors to use. With the images all being of local residents, this feels especially appropriate.  It won't be long now!

My book, "Front Porch Portraits" was on the press today, which is exciting. David Tanner at Shapco Printing and Bob are doing a great job. Thanks Dan Woychick for the expert advice. It will finish printing tomorrow and then off to the bindery.

updates.update_userinfo: "Front Porch Portraits" is going to the printer!
updates.update_content: This week, we are sending "Front Porch Portraits" to Shapco Printing to be printed and bound! The printing process itself takes about 4 weeks, so I will have the books back mid-November and you can be sure I will send them out right away. Realizing that this puts us a bit behind my original (overly optimistic) timeline, I want to thank everyone for your patience. It turns out assembling and organizing  230 photos along with captions and select quotes is an administrative challenge beyond what I anticipated.  I am thankful to Dan (Woychick) for his help, efficiency and patience. There will also now be 116 pages, instead of the original 100!

With much gratitude I can proudly say we reached our funding goal for the "Porch Portraits" book, and it's going to be printed! Thanks so much to all of you for believing in me and this project.
I am thankful to those who let me take their photo, who spread the word, who wrote kind emails, and for you, who supported the project on Kickstarter. You've all helped make this book happen.

campaign.story:
It's been an incredible response to the launch - funded in just 36 minutes, 200% in less than two hours, and now we're over 1000%! Thanks so much to everyone that's backed the project and shouted about it on social media. 
Such a great start to the campaign means that we've now unlocked all five stretch goals. Spaceship stickers, extra pages, colouring book, digital wallpapers, and a set of three spaceship bookmarks for every backer of the physical book.
 I'm Rob Turpin, but you might know me as thisnorthernboy on social media. I'm an illustrator and designer from the UK, and I LOVE spaceships. I've been drawing them since I was a little kid, from X-Wings and Tie Fighters to the Nostromo and Galactica. After a long time drawing only as a hobby, in the last four or five years I've begun working as an illustrator - producing work for books and video games, as well as private commissions. It's finally time to introduce you to my latest personal project…
Weird Field World is a science fiction, world-building book. Several years ago I began wondering what a spaceship might look like, if it had an entirely alien form of propulsion. No rockets, no warp drive, something weirder. I started sketching craft with odd canisters, pods, and spheres, all protruding from a small living module with a bubble canopy like a modern submersible. Once I'd started drawing, I started thinking about who built these spaceships and why. I decided pretty early on that I didn't want this story to be about a crazily futuristic world, I wanted it ground in the Solar System, so that meant that the builders of the spaceships had to be human - but perhaps they were built using alien technology?
In 2089 a message is received on Earth. It's come from the region of space containing the constellation Pictor - the Artist's Easel. The message is the instructions for how to build a new type of spaceship. One that can reach Mars in days rather than months, Jupiter in weeks rather than years.
The Weird Field World book is the story of that message, and of the messages that follow. It's the story of the multitude of spaceships that humans go on to build with the help of an unknown alien race. The book is filled with illustrations and sketches of these new exotic spaceships, and of the people and technology that surround them.
The book will be hardback, over 70 pages (with even more if we hit the stretch goals), and full colour. Part art book, part future history it will explain and describe the Weird Field World of Earth and the other planets, moons, and asteroids in the Solar System. Containing lots of my black and white sketches, full colour illustrations and spaceship data sheets, as well as background information, maps, and diagrams. Every copy of the book will be hand signed by me.
I've been working on this project for a couple of years now, and I'm really excited to finally be sharing it all with a larger audience.
ALL NOW UNLOCKED - £4K spaceship sticker sheets for backers of the physical book. £6K extra pages for the book. £20K 20 page downloadable spaceship colouring book. £22.5K wallpapers for your phone, tablet and computer. £25K set of three spaceship bookmarks for every backer of the physical book
Obviously the key reward is the hardback copy of the book. 70+ pages in full colour. You can choose to received a digital copy, if you like to read on a screen instead of paper. There are also reward levels to get postcards and prints, and even some original art. The highest tier allows you to name* a spaceship to be illustrated and included in the book - you can also have your name included in the background story for the spaceship. *Names will have to be agreed by me, so nothing offensive of defamatory.
Original Art Add On: If you've missed out on the original art tiers, you can simply add £120 to your pledge to receive an original spaceship illustration.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book is almost finished, and almost all of the content is already written and drawn so I don't foresee any issues completely the book and getting it off to the printers (my background is in graphic design and print production). I think the only unknown might be delays in printing and or shipping because of future Covid restrictions. At the moment I don't see any problems.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi all, just a quick update to let you know there's a new Kickstarter launched today (22nd April) that I had a hand in.
Thomas Clipper are launching pre-orders for their new men's fragrance, 'Atlantic', and I worked on the illustrations for the scent. Named in GQ's top men's fragrances for the last four years, Thomas Clipper produce modern scents for men from sustainable ingredients. I like them a lot (or I wouldn't have worked with them).

Hi all,

I've had a few messages from people in the last week or so asking when the book will ship. As per previous updates - ALL books shipped by the end of January. If you have not received your reward by now, please get in touch. Tracking information isn't generally available as I tried to keep your postage costs down. 
Hope that all makes sense.

Hi everyone,
I just wanted to post an quick update about rewards/delivery/post. The last orders went out over a month ago now, so everyone who backed a physical reward should have received them. However - between the pandemic and Brexit - things are moving a little slower than normal. I'm still getting messages from people, or seeing on social media, that some packages are only just arriving now. Scandinavia has been a tricky one because of Brexit and customs, and the US seems to vary between being super quick to glacially slow.

Hi all,
First point of order - the last forty orders will be in the mail tomorrow morning. It would have been this morning but I ran out of sticker sheets at the end of last week and had to wait for them to arrive. So that's it. All 828 books posted. Well, almost. Nine people still haven't replied to either the surveys, or email. I imagined they'll catch up with me at some point.

Hi all,
The digital book downloads are here! Thanks for your patience with this. Really hope you enjoy it. I would ask that you don't share the files with anyone else.
Rob
Just two hundred books left to package and mail out!

Hi all. Really sorry the digital copy of the book hasn't been posted yet. I'm just doing a couple of tweaks to the file. It'll be up tomorrow on an update.
Thanks for your patience.

Rob

Things are running smoothly! By Wednesday at the latest, all orders (apart from Book only) will be in the mail. Those remaining 550 Book only orders should all be packaged up by the end of the week, and in the mail by Tuesday next week.
The digital version of the book will be released tomorrow evening.
Cheers,

If you backed:
Postcards

If you were one of the backers for either of the top two tiers - your rewards are now on their way. Next to go out (tomorrow) will be all those who just backed for a set of postcards. After that It'll be All those that backed for a physical copy of the book. Posting will speed up now that I'm up to speed with the Royal Mail's online postage generation site, and I'll keep you updated as I get through the orders.

campaign.story:
My name is Fran Garcés, an illustrator and digital artist based in the Canary Islands, Spain. You may know me as Dibujante Nocturno on Instagram or Facebook. 
Thank you for taking the time to check out this Kickstarter campaign for my art book Dibujante Nocturno: The Art of Fran Garcés. 
 Together with 3dtotal Publishing, I am creating a book that reflects who I really am as an artist, by giving insight into my creative experience and processes. The book will also include my ballpoint pen sketches, many of which I have scanned and colored especially for this project, and some new digital paintings, which I can't wait to share!
Dibujante Nocturno: The Art of Fran Garcés will be beautifully presented in hardback with grained leather-effect binding and gunmetal foiling, making it a stunning addition to your art book collection. 
I see my sketchbooks as personal journals, recording important thoughts and moments in my creative journey. To offer a glimpse into my artistic mindset, I have chosen to include unseen personal sketches in this book, accompanied by notes and inner musings.
In addition to showcasing diverse galleries of my fantastical works, I will be sharing my workflow through a series of step-by-step tutorials and a collection of tips and tricks I have learned over the years as a freelance artist. Through this book I hope that I can help you to grow and develop as artists and offer inspiration for years to come.
I hope you will consider supporting this project to help make this book a reality. Thank you all very much!
Below are the exclusive items that are available in addition to the book. Some tiers and gifts are limited, so be sure to pledge quickly if you don’t want to miss out! We have put a lot of love into these items and we hope you enjoy them.
Please note that as this is a live project, all designs are examples of content I would like to include but these are subject to change.




 Launching this book through Kickstarter means we can thank those who support the book by adding extra stretch goal rewards to the campaign. I have designed high-quality bonus rewards to be given away if we can meet certain targets.






3dtotal like to give the best and most exciting stretch goals possible to their backers. For that reason we only reveal one stretch goal at a time. This allows us to respond to the success of the campaign, offering more exciting and adventurous items when the campaign does well, rather than having committed to multiple smaller inexpensive products.

3dtotal publishing is committed to having a positive effect on the environment. From 2020 they have committed to planting one tree for every book they sell by partnering with re-forestation charities. This includes books sold in their Kickstarter campaigns. If you support this campaign we would like to thank you for helping us take on this mission.
3dtotal Publishing is able to ship worldwide! Simply select your pledge option and your location, and Kickstarter will calculate the shipping for you.
All rewards will be sent out at the same time (both signed and unsigned). However, if there is a very high number of backers, please keep in mind that it will take us a few days to work our way through packaging all the rewards. 3dtotal Publishing has a fulfilment company lined up to do this as quickly as possible, so once dispatched, rewards should reach you in 10-15 working days.
We have fulfilled many successful Kickstarters and we have a great record for delivering parcels around the world. For this campaign we will be offering tracked shipping to certain locations as we're really determined that you receive your parcel first time without any hiccups or problems with delivery. Parcels sent to the UK, USA and Europe will be sent using our regular and reliable service, and parcels sent to the rest of the world will be sent with tracked shipping. Due to complications to logistics caused by the Coronavirus, some countries have introduced surcharges to receiving international postage. This is why shipping prices will seem slightly higher for some backers than it has done on our past campaigns.
Unforeseen delays that are out of our control can occur during delivery, so please allow an additional two weeks before checking up on your package. We will be doing our best to make sure everything gets to you on time!
For those who are not familiar with Kickstarter, it’s a worldwide crowd-funding platform for artists and their creative projects. Once the funding period ends, we will start finalizing the book and the extra rewards, which will be sent to you in October. About a month before that, we will send you a survey through Kickstarter, asking for your address – the reason we wait until a few weeks before is so that we have everyone’s most up-to-date details. When the survey is ready for you to fill in, you will receive an email through Kickstarter. We ask that you fill the survey in as soon as possible, to avoid any delays in sending out your reward!
  As seasoned users of Kickstarter, 3dtotal Publishing know that a very small number of backers don’t fill in the survey at the end of a Kickstarter campaign, making it impossible for us to process and ship their rewards. 3dtotal pledges to hold all rewards for backers that fail to fill in their survey for 12 months and to make multiple efforts to contact the backers in question to try to successfully deliver their items.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of the biggest challenges will be producing and delivering everything to you on time. We've selected an expert printer to work with and a fulfilment company 3dtotal Publishing has an established relationship with, so everything is in place as much as possible to ensure smooth production and delivery by the end of October 2020.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Just a quick update to say that shipping of the books will commence the week of the 16th of November. Once the books are all on their way to you, we will be back in touch with estimated delivery dates.
Thanks again!

Hi everyone,

We'd like to thank you all for your patience and understanding regarding the delay to shipping. We will hopefully have more information to update you with very soon.

Hi everyone,
The campaign has now ended, raising a fantastic total of £71,039! We are incredibly grateful to each and every one of you who has helped make this project a great success, thank you all so much for supporting Fran in making this book become a reality.

comments.content: Thank you, I emailed support.
I live in Illinois and mine came today! It's beautiful!
I have written an email to your support team, I will wait for you to respond.
Received mine yesterday in Iowa. Awesome art!!!
Hi, my book arrived (in the US) but was damaged. Some of the pages were mangled despite the well packed box. Is there anything I can do to fix this?

I have yet to receive my copy.
Thank you

Sketch book is also very nice.
thanks.

campaign.story:
It has been a while since the last eSpec Books campaign. A lot has happened both personally and professionally, but we are working diligently to get back on track. We have a passion for publishing quality fiction and we could not do that without all of you. (Thank you, by the way.)
This go-around we have three books we want to do: In Harm's Way (Defending the Future Book 8), Footprints in the Stars (Beyond the Cradle Book 2) and Devil Dancers, a single-author collection by Robert E. Waters. If we hit our goal the first one will be funded. From there we work to unlock the other books via the stretch goals.
 IN HARM'S WAY - DEFENDING THE FUTURE BOOK 8
edited by Mike McPhail, series editor: Mike McPhail
A military science fiction anthology with the theme of rescue and recovery missions.
With stories by Brenda Cooper, Bud Sparhawk, David Sherman, Robert E. Waters, Jeff Young, James Chambers, Lisanne Norman, Robert Greenberger, Aaron Rosenberg, Christopher M. Hiles, Eric Hardenbrook, and Danielle Ackley-McPhail.
   *******************************MORE DETAILS TO COME**************************** 
FOOTPRINTS IN THE STARS - BEYOND THE CRADLE BOOK 2
edited by Danielle Ackley-McPhail, series editor: Mike McPhail
A traditional science fiction collection with the theme of the discovery of evidence of other life in the universe and how those discoveries impact humanity. 
With stories by Jody Lynn Nye, James Chambers, Robert Greenberger, Keith R.A. DeCandido, Aaron Rosenberg, Christopher L. Bennett, Dayton Ward, Judi Fleming, Russ Colchamiro, Bryan J.L. Glass, Gordon Linzner, Ian Randal Strock, and Danielle Ackley-McPhail.
(Editor's note: these are not first-contact stories. They are about the effect of such discoveries on humanity.)
 *******************************MORE DETAILS TO COME****************************
DEVIL DANCERS a single-author collection by Robert E. Waters
A military science fiction collection featuring linked stories in the author's Devil Dancers' universe. Contains reprints and stories original to this collection.
 *******************************MORE DETAILS TO COME****************************
UNLOCKED! AND DONE - FIRST 15 BACKER BONUS - The first 15 backers will receive a code for a free audiobook download of the short story collection, The Die Is Cast, with stories by Danielle Ackley-McPhail and Mike McPhail.
UNLOCKED! AND DONE - FIRST-DAY EARLY BACKER BONUS - All those backing within the first twenty-four hours of the campaign will receive a DRM-free copy of The Die Is Cast.
UNLOCKED! AND DONE - SECOND-DAY EARLY BACKER BONUS - All those backing within the second twenty-four hours of the campaign will receive a DRM-free copy of Danielle Ackley-McPhail's short story collection Between Darkness and Light.
UNLOCKED! AND DONE - FIRST 50 BACKER BONUS - The first 50 backers will receive a DRM-free copy of Brenda Cooper's POST. 
UNLOCKED! FIRST 100 BACKER BONUS - The first 100 backers will receive a DRM-free copy of David Sherman's Issue in Doubt. 
BUDDY ENLISTMENT BONUS - Tell a friend about this campaign. If both of you back it you each get one bonus book added to your pledge reward in the format in keeping with your pledge. This can be reserved for a future release.
UNLOCKED! $1000 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of Danielle Ackley-McPhail's short story "A Moment Out of Time".
UNLOCKED! $1300 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of James Daniel Ross's short story "Not One Word".
UNLOCKED! $1600 -  All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of Mike McPhail's short story "Beyond Imagine".
UNLOCKED! $1900 - We will produce a second anthology, FOOTPRINTS IN THE STARS and the book will be added to the available Pledge Rewards and Add-On section. 
UNLOCKED! $2200 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of L. Jagi Lamplighter's short story "A Few More Bugs to Work Out".
UNLOCKED! $2500 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of James Chambers' short story "Law of the Kuzzi".
UNLOCKED! $2800 - We will produce a bonus collection, DEVIL DANCERS by Robert E. Waters and the book will be added to the available Pledge Rewards and Add-On section.
$3100 - All backers at the $5 and higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of David Sherman's original, never before published short story "BillyC".
$3400 -  All backers at the $5 and higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of Keith R.A. DeCandido's science fiction novel, GUILT IN INNOCENCE.
$3700 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of L. Jagi Lamplighter's short story "Faces and Enigmas".
$4000 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of David Sherman's short story "Going after Yeechiphooie".
$4300 - All backers at the $5 and higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of Keith R.A. DeCandido's urban fantasy novel  A FURNACE SEALED.
$4600 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of L. Jagi Lamplighter's short story "Overhead on the Public School Virtual Band 447".
$4900 - All backers at the $5 or higher level will receive a DRM-free copy of David Sherman's short story "The Price of Friendship".
Quick Explanation: Kickstarter doesn't really have an intuitive way to do add-ons, and the process can be confusing, so here's a quick explanation. To add one of the below onto your current pledge, just click on the "Manage Your Pledge" button at the top right of the page, click in the "Pledge Amount" box, and change the pledge amount to reflect the addition of the amount of the add-on you want.  
Example: if your current pledge amount is $10, and you want to add a $5 add-on, you would click into the "Pledge Amount" box and change the pledge amount to $15. At the end of the Kickstarter, we'll send out a questionnaire to find out what add-ons you contributed for.  
NOTES: all ebooks listed available in .epub, mobi, or .pdf, unless indicated. Also, we can autograph a book to whomever you want and you can order more than one copy of the same book when doing an add-on.
$5 - Add a DRM-Free digital copy of In Harm's Way , Footprints in the Stars, or Devil Dancers to your pledge.   
$10 – Add DRM-Free digital copies of the Jeffrey Lyman eShorts collection: The Fall of Autumn, Lord of Fire, Lord of Wind, and The Troll King to your pledge.   
$10 – Add a custom Defending the Future sew-on patch to your order. If you have not backed at a physical level, please add $2 shipping.  
$10 – Add DRM-Free digital copies of James Daniel Ross's five Radiation Angels short stories, Not One Word, Revestak, The Oath, The Nature of Mercy, and A Different Kind of Courage.
$20 – Upgrade your digital copy of In Harm's Way, Footprints in the Stars, or Devil Dancers to a print copy.  
$25 – Add a print copy of  In Harm's Way , Footprints in the Stars, or Devil Dancers to your pledge.    
$25/$5 – Add a print or DRM-free ebook copy of the eSpec Books title of your choice to your pledge (Dragon Precinct, Unicorn Precinct, Goblin Precinct, Gryphon Precinct, Mermaid Precinct, Tales from Dragon Precinct, Stories of Fremont's Children, Among the Wild Cybers, Shattered Dreams, Dogs of War, Man and Machine, The Die is Cast, In Harm's Way, The Best of Defending the Future, The Best of Bad-Ass Faeries, If We Had Known, POST, Sister Paradox, In the Lamplight, Clockwork Witch, Spirit Seeker, After Punk, Gaslight and Grimm, The Weird Wild West, The Society for the Preservation of CJ Henderson, Without a License, Awakened Modern, The Side of Good/The Side of Evil, Issue in Doubt, and In All Directions). Multiply by the number of titles desired if you want more than one. They make great gifts! (Includes domestic shipping. If you're a backer outside the U.S. who has backed at a level that does not include shipping, please add $30 for shipping.)   
$25/$5 – Add a print or DRM-free ebook copy of the Paper Phoenix Press title of your choice to your pledge (Three Chords of Chaos, The Halfling's Court, The Redcaps' Queen, Eternal Wanderings, Yesterday's Dreams, The Ginger KICK! Cookbook, The Literary Handyman, Transcendence, A Legacy of Stars, and Consigned to the Sea). Multiply by the number of titles desired if you want more than one. They make great gifts! (Includes domestic shipping. If you're a backer outside the U.S. who has backed at a level that does not include shipping, please add $30 for shipping.)    
Author and editor Mike McPhail is the co-owner of eSpec Books LLC, Electronic Speculative Fiction Publishing (since 2014). Although involved in numerous projects, he is best known as the creator and series editor of the award-winning Defending The Future series of military science fiction anthologies—now in its second decade of publication.
His love of the science fiction genre sparked a life-long interest in science, technology, and developing an understanding of the human condition—all of which play an important role in his writing, art, and game design—these in turn are built upon his training as an aeronautical engineer, and dreams of becoming a NASA mission specialist.
As a former Airman, he is member of the Military Writers Society of America, and is dedicated to helping his fellow service members (and those deserving civilians) in their efforts to become authors, editors, or artist, as well as supporting related organization in their efforts to help those "who have given their all for us."  
Award-winning author and editor Danielle Ackley-McPhail has worked both sides of the publishing industry for longer than she cares to admit. In 2014 she joined forces with husband Mike McPhail and friend Greg Schauer to form her own publishing house, eSpec Books. 
Her published works include six novels, Yesterday's Dreams, Tomorrow's Memories, Today’s Promise, The Halfling’s Court, The Redcaps’ Queen, and Baba Ali and the Clockwork Djinn, written with Day Al-Mohamed. She is also the author of the solo collections Eternal Wanderings, A Legacy of Stars, Consigned to the Sea, Flash in the Can, Transcendence, Between Darkness and Light,  Eternal Wanderings, and the non-fiction writers’ guide, The Literary Handyman. Her short stories are included in numerous other anthologies and collections.
James Chambers is an award-winning author of horror, crime, fantasy, and science fiction. He wrote the Bram Stoker Award®-winning graphic novel, Kolchak the Night Stalker: The Forgotten Lore of Edgar Allan Poe. Publisher’s Weekly described The Engines of Sacrifice, his collection of four Lovecraftian-inspired novellas published by Dark Regions Press as “…chillingly evocative…” in a starred review. His story, “A Song Left Behind in the Aztakea Hills,” was nominated for a Bram Stoker Award.
He has authored the short story collection Resurrection House and several novellas, including The Dead Bear Witness and Tears of Blood, in the Corpse Fauna novella series. He also wrote the illustrated story collection, The Midnight Hour: Saint Lawn Hill and Other Tales, created in collaboration with artist Jason Whitley.
Brenda Cooper writes science fiction and fantasy novels and short stories, and sometimes, poetry.  Her most recent novel is Spear of Darkness, from Pyr and her most recent story collection is Cracking the Sky from Fairwood Press. Brenda is a technology professional and a futurist, and publishes non-fiction on the environment and the future.  Her non-fiction has appeared on Slate and Crosscut and her short fiction has appeared in Nature Magazine, among other venues.
Brenda lives in the Pacific Northwest in a household with three people, three dogs, far more than three computers, and only one TV in it.  
Judi Fleming works as a training specialist and instructional designer for the federal government in her day job and thus much of her writing is of the non-exciting technical sort. She is a graduate of Seton Hill University Writing Popular Fiction Master’s Program. Her stories have appeared in No Man's Land, Best Laid Plans, and Dogs of War.
Robert Greenberger is a writer and editor. He has worked for Starlog Press, where he created Comics Scene, the first nationally distributed magazine to focus on comic books, comic strips, and animation, DC Comics, Marvel Comics, Weekly World News, Famous Monsters of Filmland, ComicMix.com, and is a founding member of Crazy 8 Press. His dozens of books, short stories, and essays include Hellboy II: The Golden Army, for which he won the IAMTW’s Scribe Award, and The Further Adventures of Sherlock Holmes: Murder at Sorrow’s Crown, co-written with Steven Savile. He is a member of the Science Fiction Writers of America and the International Association of Media Tie-In Writers, and holds a Master of Science in Education from the University of Bridgeport and a Master of Arts in Creative Writing & Literature for Educators from Fairleigh Dickinson University.
Eric Hardenbrook is a fan, an author and an artist, usually in that order. Eric lives in central Pennsylvania with his gorgeous wife and daughter. He writes to try to get the stories out of his head. His stories can be found in TV Gods, Best Laid Plans, and Dogs of War. When he's being a fan he helps run Watch The Skies and assists in the publication of their monthly fanzine. He can be found (at least some of the time) at The Pretend Blog. When not working on those things, Eric enjoys the occasional video or board game and is an old school role player.
Christopher M. Hiles is a nurse and emergency manager specializing in Mass Casualty and Mass Fatality Incidents. He serves in the Civil Air Patrol, the United States Air Force Auxiliary, where he has held the position of Squadron Commander and Wing Health Services Officer. His work appears in Dogs of War and If We Had Known. He lives in Baltimore, Maryland, with his wife and puppy.
Lisanne Norman was born in Glasgow, Scotland, and has lived in the USA since 2004.
"Strong-willed, independent, a whirlwind, a dreamer, she lives in another world."  These phrases followed her around from her earliest days.  They were partly right: she had grander plans than a world, though, she was already creating the universe of the Sholan Alliance, where Magic, Warriors, and Science all co-exist.
She began writing when she was eight because she couldn't find enough of the books she liked to read.  How difficult can it be to write them myself, she thought with all the confidence of a child.  After all, the libraries were full of books.  It must be easy.
Real life took over as she entered college and began to work for the first time, but thanks to the constant nagging of two very good friends, one of whom is the sister of her editor, she finished a novel she'd started back in 1979. It was called Turning Point, and her friend's sister at DAW bought it. The Sholan Alliance Series is now nine novels long. She also has several short stories out in DAW anthologies, and one in Defending the Future series number IV, "No Man's Land" called "Valkyries".
 Jody Lynn Nye lists her main career activity as ‘spoiling cats.’ When not engaged upon this worthy occupation, she writes fantasy and science fiction books and short stories. 
Her newest books are Moon Tracks (Baen), a young adult hard science fiction novel, the second in collaboration with Dr. Travis S. Taylor. Rhythm of the Imperium, third in the Lord Thomas Kinago series; Pros and Cons (WordFire Press), a nonfiction book about conventions in collaboration with Bill Fawcett; and the 20th novel in the Myth-Adventures series, Myth-Fits.
Over the last thirty or so years, Jody has taught in numerous writing workshops and participated on hundreds of panels covering the subjects of writing and being published at science-fiction conventions. She has also spoken in schools and libraries around the north and northwest suburbs. In 2007 she taught fantasy writing at Columbia College Chicago. She also runs the two-day writers workshop at DragonCon. She and her husband are the fiction reviewers for Galaxy’s Edge Magazine. In 2016, Jody joined the judging staff of the Writers of the Future contest, the world’s largest science fiction and fantasy writing contest for new authors. 
Jody lives in the northwest suburbs of Chicago, with her husband Bill Fawcett, a writer, game designer, military historian and book packager, and three feline overlords, Athena, Minx, and Marmalade. Check out her websites at www.jodylynnnye.com and mythadventures.net. She is on Facebook as Jody Lynn Nye and Twitter @JodyLynnNye. 
Aaron Rosenberg is the author of the best-selling DuckBob series (consisting of No Small Bills, Too Small for Tall, and Three Small Coinkydinks), the Dread Remora space-opera series and, with David Niall Wilson, the O.C.L.T. occult thriller series. His tie-in work contains novels for Star Trek, Warhammer, WarCraft, and Eureka. He has written children’s books (including the original series Pete and Penny's Pizza Puzzles, the award-winning Bandslam: The Junior Novel, and the #1 best-selling 42: The Jackie Robinson Story), educational books on a variety of topics, and over seventy roleplaying games (such as the original games Asylum, Spookshow, and Chosen, work for White Wolf, Wizards of the Coast, Fantasy Flight, Pinnacle, and many others, and both the Origins Award-winning Gamemastering Secrets and the Gold ENnie-winning Lure of the Lich Lord). He is the co-creator of the ReDeus series, and one of the founders of Crazy 8 Press. Aaron lives in New York with his family. You can follow him online at gryphonrose.com, on Facebook at facebook.com/gryphonrose, and on Twitter @gryphonrose.
David Sherman is the author or co-author of some three dozen books, most of which are about Marines in combat.
He has written about US Marines in Vietnam (the Night Fighters series and three other novels), and the DemonTech series about Marines in a fantasy world. The 18th Race trilogy is military science fiction.
Other than military, he wrote a non-conventional vampire novel, The Hunt, and a mystery, Dead Man's Chest. He has also released a collection of short fiction and non-fiction from early in his writing career, Sherman's Shorts; the Beginnings.
With Dan Cragg he wrote the popular Starfist series and its spin off series, Starfist: Force Recon—all about Marines in the Twenty-fifth Century.; and a Star Wars novel, Jedi Trial.
His books have been translated into Czech, Polish, German, and Japanese.
He lives in sunny South Florida, where he doesn't have to worry about hypothermia or snow-shoveling-induced heart attacks. He invites readers to visit his website, novelier.com.
Bud Sparhawk is the author of the novels Distant Seas, Vixen, and Shattered Dreams, as well as two print collections: Sam Boone: Front To Back, and Dancing with Dragons. He has three e-Novels available through Amazon and other channels. 
Bud has been a three-time novella finalist for the Nebula award: Primrose and Thorn (Analog, May 1996), Magic’s Price (Analog, March 2001), and Clay’s Pride (Analog, July/August 2004). His work has appeared in two Year’s Best anthologies: Year’s Best SF #11 (EOS), David Harwell-Editor) and The Years Best Science Fiction, Fourteenth Annual Collection, (St Martins Press, Garner Dozois – Editor.) 
His short stories have appeared frequently in Analog Fact/Fiction, less so in Asimov’s, as well as in five Defending the Future and other anthologies, publications and audio books. He has put out several collections of some of his published works in ebook format. A complete bibliography can be found at: http://budsparhawk.com.
He also writes an occasional blog on the pain of writing at http://budsparhawk.blogspot.com.
Robert E Waters had been writing and publishing stories since 2003, with his first publication in Weird Tales. Since then, he has published over 30 stories in various print and on-line magazines and anthologies, including e-Spec's WIERD WILD WEST and the "Defending the Future" Mil SF anthology series. Robert is also a frequent contributor to Eric Flint's alternate history series, 1632/Ring of Fire, with several stories published in the on-line Grantville Gazette, and most recently in Baen Book's Ring of Fire IV anthology. Robert's first novel, The Wayward Eight: A Contract to Die For, was released in 2014 under the Zmok imprint, and is a "weird wild west" adventure set in the Wild West Exodus gaming universe. Robert lives in Baltimore, Maryland with his wife Beth, their son Jason, and their cat Buzz.
Jeff Young is a bookseller first and a writer second – although he wouldn’t mind a reversal of fortune.
He is an award winning author who has contributed to the anthologies: Writers of the Future V.26, Afterpunk, In an Iron Cage: The Magic of Steampunk, Clockwork Chaos, Gaslight and Grimm, By Any Means, Best Laid Plans, Dogs of War, Man and Machine, If We Had Known, Fantastic Futures 13, The Society for the Preservation of C.J. Henderson, TV Gods & TV Gods: Summer Programming. Jeff’s own fiction is collected in Spirit Seeker and TOI Special Edition 2 – Diversiforms. He has also edited the Drunken Comic Book Monkey line, TV Gods and TV Gods –Summer Programming. He has led the Watch the Skies SF&F Discussion Group of Camp Hill and Harrisburg for seventeen years. Jeff is also the proprietor of Helm Haven, the online Etsy and Ebay shops, costuming resources for Renaissance and Steampunk. 
Graphics designer Mike McPhail is the owner of McP Digital Graphics (founded in 2006), a company established to provide cover art, design, layout, and prepress services. This built upon not only his experience as a game designer and mechanical and computer draftsman, but primarily from his time as the proofing supervisor for Phoenix Color Corp in the Manhattan office, doing cover work for the great publishing houses.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All three books are either in our possession or currently in the works. We do not anticipate any problems producing them, though in publishing there is the possibility of production delays. eSpec does, however, have a proven track record of delivering the promised product.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone.
I hope you are enjoying your new year. Just a line to let you know I have 42 hours left my personal campaign for my three collections, More Tips from the Handyman (a writer's guide) and two short story collections. If you have a chance, could you check it out, maybe spread the word? I have run out of steam and this poor baby has been languishing. Make 100: Three Collected Works.
Thank you, and may the new year be kinder to us all than the last one.

Hi, all.
Just wanted to share news of a project from our friends at Crazy 8 Press.
Thrilling Adventure Yarns 2 edited by Robert Greenberger, has one week to go. In addition to myself, some of you will recognize many of the names involved from past eSpec projects, including Footprints in the Stars (in bold). Others you may know from your own reading:

Hi everyone,
I’ve been trying not to bombard you, but I did want to let you know we are just three days away from the end of the current campaign, Lucky Devils and Witchy Ways.

Hello, my lovelies!
I don't believe I mentioned here because the project is mostly fantasy and steampunk, but we have a new campaign running right now. We are just over a week in and we have funded four books, unlocked six bonus short stories, are 10 backers away from unlocking two bonus novellas. If you are curious, the campaign is called Lucky Devils and Witchy Ways, for an urban fantasy/cyberpunk mash-up from Megan Mackie, a steampunk magic novel from Michelle D. Sonnier, a science fiction novel from Ty Drago, and an anthology called Horns and Halos about devils and angels.

Good morning! (apologies to anyone receiving this multiple times. KS hasn't given me a way to update you all at once yet.)
Just 27 hours left in our current campaign for, originally, two science fiction novels by David Sherman (co-writing with Keith DeCandido) and Christopher Bennett. So far we have unlocked ELEVEN stretch goals for six bonus short stories, a cool custom patch, and FOUR more books!!!

Hi, everyone.
We hope you are doing well during this trying time.
Despite the corona-chaos going on, we are still striving to be productive and continue to provide quality speculative fiction. We have just launched a campaign to fund two science fiction books and hope you might check it out.
At this holiday season, we wanted to say thank you for throwing your lot in with us here at eSpec Books and helping to make our dream possible.

The text is complete for Devil Dancers and we are finalizing the cover.
By the end of this month or early next month all physical rewards will be sent out. Most of them already have, as of today, but there are two of you who snagged all three books. 
All digital rewards will definitely be fulfilled before the end of the month.

Hi, all.
Bonuses are coming soon. So are books. In Harm's Way and Footprints in the Stars are almost done editing and typesetting will follow soon after. Devil Dancers will take a little longer, but not much.
If you haven't filled out your surveys, please do so as soon as possible.

campaign.story:
What we put on our skin is just as important as what we put in our bodies.  Although the skin is the body's largest organ, many of us take it for granted.
               As part of Orijin's mandate to promote self-care and mindfulness, we’ve developed the 100% all-natural and biodegradable Orijin Sponge. Made from Japanese Konjac Plant Root and infused with anti-microbial bamboo charcoal, the Orijin Sponge will provide your skin with the TLC it deserves while also heightening your showering experience. 
 Most bathing sponges you’ll find in-store or online today are made with the use of chemicals, synthetic oils, plastic and artificial coloring. These “glorified plastic bags” as we like to call them, are a breeding ground for dank smells and bacterial growth, do absolutely nothing for our skin and take over 150 years to decompose!
Made completely from 100% all natural Konjac plant root, the Orijin sponge's powerful fibers are naturally alkaline and hydrating. In addition, the Orijin Sponge exfoliates even the most sensitive skin without irritation.
Infused with Bamboo Charcoal, the Orijin Sponge is anti-microbial allowing the konjac fibers to absorb debris and impurities without allowing bacteria to grow or linger.
The Orijin Sponge is ergonomically designed to fit perfectly in hand while providing great coverage for an easy and thorough full body scrub down.
Said to have been discovered by Japanese farmers who used konjac to wash their babies' skin because of the plants gentle and natural features,  Konjac is native to Japan and has been used since the 6th century. 
When Dry, the Orijin Sponge is 3x smaller dimensionally and more than 11.5x lighter in weight. When dry the Orijin Sponge weighs only 17grams and when fully hydrated it increases to the perfect weight of 198g.
 Feel free to use the Orijin Sponge all over your body, especially on the chest, back & face.  These areas are easily acne-prone and need an extra deep clean. The Orijin Sponge is gentle enough to be used on sensitive areas, like around your eyes, while tough and sturdy enough for a full body scrub down. 
3D Design Rendering | Orijin Sponge
 The surface of the Orijin Sponge was designed to help channel water away from the surface for a better lathering experience and for more efficient drying time when the Orijin Sponge is not in use.   
 There’s no comparison. Based on our ergonomic size, design properties and environmental footprint we take the lead by a long shot. 
Just last year more that 4,000 awesome supporters brought The Thinking Egg (our previous campaign) to life, making it the most successful mindfulness tool to ever launch on Kickstarter. The feedback after having shipped on time to all of our supporters was awesome. We'll be continuing that tradition come fulfillment time for your Orijin Sponge!
 
   At Orijin, we intentionally design products that harmoniously intertwine form and function.
 Our hope is that we can provide you with products and ideas to help live a more present, aware and conscious life.
Thank you for taking a look at our campaign. If you have any questions, please reach out, we'd be happy to help!
   This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them. 
This project is promoted by Green Inbox
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we have budgeted sufficient resources and time, we know that there might be things outside of our control and current visibility. That being said, we are extremely committed to doing everything in our power to solve any challenges that may arise along the way. That's a promise!

Our supply chain is tried and true. 
We have our manufacturing and operations all ready to go, and we've made sure to leave enough time so your Orijin Sponge/s arrive as planned. We are confident that our calculated plan will work effectively once we're funded, and that we'll be putting your Orijin Sponge in your hands no later than November!

Thank you in advance for making this project come to life ♥
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
The Orijin Sponge is 100% natural and will slowly and naturally begin to fray after about 120-150 uses (anywhere from 5-8 months depending on how often you shower). Once it's begun to fray, you'll still be able to use the Orijin Sponge, but you will not receive the same benefits as you would with a fresh Orijin Sponge.

When you're done, you can simply compost the Orijin Sponge or put it in your planter to provide extra moisture and minerals to your good ol' plants!
Environmentally friendly factories
Because the Orijin Sponge is 100% natural, it'll simply decompose once you're done with it.

comments.content: Marc Lutgen
You still owe me six sponges from your earlier project. When will I get those?
I am backer #4206 and did not receive my order. Please advise!
Never received my order.
Kickstarter, you have failed to support your backers again.
I wanted to inform you, that I habe not received my order. Please advise. Thanks!
I have not received them yet. Am I to understand that I will the 2.0 version?
Thanks again and keep up the great work.
I love these. The face one has lasted me 3 months of twice a day use. The body one has lasted over 4 months so far. Tried all three and absolutely love them all.
NOT RECOMMENDED AT ALL!

My sponges lasted for 3 weeks at the most but I liked the idea sooo, dummy me went to their website to order 1 sponge and a facial sponge. This was back on July 2. Guess what, still no sponges even though received the money. Shipping problems my bum.
If you haven't gotten yours - read the comments they are leaving. EMAIL IN!
I order 4 sponges and all last 2 weeks maximum in a daily use. I send an email and the company send me 3more for free, but nothing change...2weeks maximum and they simple desintregrate.
Oh I know this product it broke apart just from 2 weeks of usage.
Haven’t received mine yet, and now I need to change my address. How do I do that?
I honestly would like to have either a refund or to be sent another lot of sponges as like the others I had my sponges unusable after a few uses.
Never received because the company refused to update my address weeks before it even shipped. Very disappointed and horrible customer service.
I thought I wasn't handling mines properly, I bought 3 sponges, the 3 of them had holes within 3 or 4 uses and then fell apart..
I'm another disappointed backer. Disintegrated within a month. Won't back another disappearing sponge. Glad some were satisfied.

I'm curious how wide spread the disintegrating sponges are.. And what constitutes a disintegration? I've been using my sponges since I received them back in November and they're holding up just fine? The most used one is starting to show a bit of wear, but I sort of expect that after months of use.
Hope Sponges 2.0 increase longevity by months not days.
I agree with alot of the comments here. My sponges completely disintegrated too. I really wasn’t happy with this project.
Send them an email. KS doesn’t make it easy for them to answer comments after a project is closed.

People really should be careful with how they say things are a scam... Could damage the credibility of a smaller company! All yall have to do is read what there saying and email in - I've messaged in many times with questions and they respond ASAP.
never received mine ..very dissapointed :(
