campaign.story:
“The story calls to the reader in a way Lovecraft would approve of with a nod and a wry smile. I couldn't put it down if I wanted to.” ~  The Phantom Star.net   (REVIEW FOR: LOVECRAFT P.I. THE CURIOUS CASE OF ReANIMATOR vol.2)
Cover Illustration by Paul Shipper
   Greetings from the land of eldritch horror. My name is D.W. Kann  and I am the writer/creator of the LOVECRAFT P.I. - THE CURIOUS CASE OF ReANIMATOR graphic novel. In the latest installment of the series, a  bizarre case file takes our chain smoking, lantern-jawed detective Ward Lovecraft to New Orleans circa 1932. 

                 I'm  looking forward to sharing this new adventure with you all. Fans of H.P. Lovecraft will discover some wonderful Easter eggs hidden throughout these pages. I've spent the last two years deeply immersed within H.P.'s works and personal biography to expand the story’s scope beyond the happenings in Volume One.

                 I’ve  been a Lovecraft fan myself for decades. It began with my first introduction to his work in 1985 when, at the tender age of 14, I saw Stuart Gordon's RE-ANIMATOR for the first time. The gory masterpiece blew my mind. In re-imagining  such an iconic character, I wanted to explore the psychological depths of Herbert West and elaborate on what I believe he would accomplish under certain circumstances. So sit back and enjoy this tale over your favorite cup of coffee or delicious absinthe. Let this Curious Case  creep into your subconscious.                   
~ Keep it Dark
 “It’s fantastic! He’s like old school Columbo.”  ~ Petesbasement.com (REVIEW FOR: LOVECRAFT P.I. A SHOT IN THE DARK vol.1)
Telegram from G.G. Angell to Detective Ward Lovecraft
  “I received this telegram from my old friend, G.G. Angell, an authority on ancient inscriptions and Semitic languages.
From what local law told the Old Man, it seems our Inspector Legrasse lost nine of his men while investigating a tip from a survivor of some sort of Voodoo cult, deep within the infamous Black Swamp.” - Detective Ward Lovecraft.
"The Heroes" Characters designed by Daniel Sguiglia
 “Lovecraft P.I. combines the eldritch horror of Lovecraft with the gritty realism of a Humphrey Bogart film, creating a mesmerizing world of mystery and cosmic terror in which there is no escape.” ~ B-Movie Bros  (REVIEW FOR: LOVECRAFT P.I. THE CURIOUS CASE OF ReANIMATOR vol.2)
"The Baddies" Characters designed by Daniel Sguiglia
 “You can practically smell the cigarette smoke coming from these pages.”  ~  comicwhisperer.blogspot.com (REVIEW FOR: LOVECRAFT P.I. A SHOT IN THE DARK vol.1)
Det. Ward Lovecraft arrives at the shuttered 'Old Absinthe House' in the French Quarter, New Orleans.
"Insp. Legrasse’s report is peppered with what one can only describe as hallucinogenic nightmares. One wonders why we aren’t chatting in a rubber room, rather than a speakeasy." ~ Lovecraft.
"I think Ms. Copetrix’s sinewy presence unnerved the big lug." ~ Lovecraft
“In his house at R’lyeh dead Cthulhu waits dreaming.” ~ Lovecraft
“I hope the creators of Lovecraft P.I. Love what they do because in my opinion, they should be doing this for a long time to come.” ~      comicwhisperer.blogspot.com (REVIEW FOR: LOVECRAFT P.I. A SHOT IN THE DARK vol.1)
PLAY

PLAY

1928 GLOW-IN-THE-DARK R'lyeh Constellation Map
LOVECRAFT P.I. is a mash-up between 1930’s pulp detective novels and the horror masterpieces of the legendary H.P. Lovecraft. 
Volume One's case file; A SHOT IN THE DARK written by Fritz Striker and D.W. Kann, takes us to 1937 Innsmouth, Massachusetts where  Ward Lovecraft, unearths a secret cult, solves a murder, and locates a  rare volume of the sinister Necronomicon text before unspeakable evil is unleashed on the world. This  three-issue series is now a trade paperback and available for the first  time on Kickstarter. We were fortunate enough to have world-renowned  illustrator Paul Shipper create three fantastic covers. THE CURIOUS CASE  OF ReANIMATOR will be our fourth collaboration.
  Cover illustratons by Paul Shipper
After  completing the first issue we brought the project to Kickstarter and raised an incredible $12,323 with 248 backers. In the midst of completing these books we toured the U.S. and attended various Comic Cons to spread the word to new fans.   
None  of this would have been possible, we owe it all to you, dear backers, and your faith in a group of writers and artists who came together. To create an ever-expanding universe, based on the works of one of our favorite authors, H.P. Lovecraft, and one simple idea. 
"What if...?" 
We hope you all join us in supporting this new book, we've had a blast creating it and look forward to further adventures of DET. WARD LOVECRAFT.
MANY THANKS TO YOU ALL! ~ D.W. Kann
Some of the venues you may catch LOVECRAFT P.I. at this year. The H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival and Cthulhu Con in Portland, OR, Jewelry City Steampunk, MA, Watch City Steam Punk Festival, MA, and Terrificon, CT. 
Always awesome to meet fans of our work!    ~ Keep it Dark 
STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED! by Artist Jason Lenox
STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED! by Artist Corlen Kruger
STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED! By Artist Dan Cooney
STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED! by Artist Dan Brereton
Once the campaign ends, funds take from 2-4 weeks to be processed by Kickstarter. From there we will begin manufacturing with an August ship date. All digital rewards will land in your inboxes prior. 
Detective Ward Lovecraft will continue his adventures among the cosmic unknown. With volume 3 entitled:    LOVECRAFT P.I. in THE WILCOX EXPERIMENT coming 2020
Darkside Media LLC is an independent publishing/production company founded by  D.W. Kann in 2001.  The talent behind LOVECRAFT P.I. comes from artists around the world, we are lucky enough to have all on board to create this fantastical universe and continue to do so. Daniel, Damián and Joel have been with Darkside Media for several years now, not only working on LOVECRAFT P.I. but also our other series BERSERKERS: SOLO ISLAND which will be out next year. We are also super fortunate to have the world renowned illustrator Paul Shipper leading us with his wonderful covers of the LPI series. 
Story by, Creative Director, Publisher D.W. Kann
Sketch, Design and Illustrations by Daniel Sguiglia 
Coloring by Damián Peñalba 
Graphic Design and Lettering by Joel Saavedra
Cover Illustration by Paul Shipper
Editor-in-Chief Onrie Kompan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are risks with every endeavor. For us, we have taken the risk out by working on this project diligently throughout the last year. We understand the demand for having the product delivered in a timely manner. So for us, this is a new horizon, in making sure each and everyone is taken care of with expediency. 

We have gone over our timelines and have allotted for any overages. As always I will be keeping everyone up to date during and after the process of delivery. 

Our $3500K pledge is for us in keeping the manufacturing process alive and delivering these great stories to you, our backers. We’re looking forward to your continued support. 

Thank you ~ DW Kann
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: NEW x2 LIMIT REWARD!!! MAKE A CAMEO APPEARENCE IN THE NEW EPILOGUE! PLUS SPOTLIGHT!
updates.update_content:
Greetings from the M.S.D.A.,
With the new EPILOGUE progressing, I love having the opportunity to add you, our backer in as a CAMEO. So far I have TWO APPEARANCES (ONE LEFT!) that are good fun! They're CULT OF CTHULHU ARMED SAILORS, who escort the infamous DR. HERBERT WEST, to his potential demise. That's all I can give away at the moment. Both of these CAMEOS are  considered 'red shirts' of the group, so they'll meet a very untimely,  but wildly unexpected death, while also sparking a huge plot turn!
This is considered a Once the  campaign wraps, we'll be requesting a clear image of your face and have  you sign a release form, so we may immortalize you within the eternal mythos of Yours truly will also sign each copy. :)

updates.update_userinfo: APRIL 13th PRE-LAUNCH STRETCH GOAL FOR LOVECRAFT P.I. CAMPAIGN!
updates.update_content:
Greetings from the M.S.D.A.,
I hope everyone is enjoying their weekend. My apologies if some backers are seeing this multiple times today. Wanted to make sure everyone received this new update. 
This TUESDAY APRIL 13th at 8 am EST we launch a new LOVECRAFT P.I. Campaign. So we wanted to try something a little different. With today being my  birthday and you only turn half a century once, I wanted to celebrate it  with you all in announcing this new 'EXCLUSIVE' DEEP ONE trading card.

I wanted to bring to your attention a new campaign that we have currently going on Kickstarter over the next (8) days. It's the first issue of an (8) issue limited series we'll be putting out every several weeks through here. Trailer enclosed! LINK TO CAMPAIGN: http://kck.st/3un4ggl
In 1950, off the coast of Massachusetts, a small island known as Solo  was subject to a deadly virus that overtook its inhabitants.

updates.update_userinfo: CROSSOVER PART 2: SCOOBY VARIANT UPDATE with TIMELAPSE! PLUS NEW REVIEW!
updates.update_content:
Greetings from 1932, Washington D.C.,
I know some of you may have seen this recent update on the part 2  campaign. Wanted to share it all with you here as well. Our illustrator Corlen Kruger is hard at work on the "Scooby Doo Halloween Variant."  He wanted to  share his progress, not only via this illustration, but  also his WIP condensed 6min time-lapse video of him tinkering away.

GREETINGS FROM THE M.S.D.A.
Thank you to all our supports who are continuing to spread the word and also coming back for more! One of our ADD-ONS is the MICRO BUST of our DEEP ONE resin kit. A fan who purchased this at a comic con last year, Innkeeper Vase Odin from www.thegreatoldonesgaming.com was kind enough to share his paint job of this horrid, nightmarish creature with us.

GREETINGS FROM THE M.S.D.A.,
We're having an amazing day, surpassing our crossover goal within 3 min of launch this am. Currently we're approaching $9,000 and still have hours to go before we wrap out our first 24. We'll pass our previous LOVECRAFT P.I. THE CURIOUS CASE OF ReANIMATOR campaign in just hours! That's an amazing record and it all has to do with your awesome support!

campaign.story:
Skies of Fire is a limited comic series by Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou, with art by Pablo Peppino and Bryan Valenza. Skies was launched in 2014 has remained 100% independent through crowdfunding and the support of our fans. Last year we created a beautiful clothbound hardcover trade edition collecting our first four issues. This year, we're back with the second half of the series! 
This campaign's goal is to raise funds to print the fifth issue of Skies of Fire. Any additional funds will be funneled back directly into the production of future editions of the series. 


Skies of Fire takes place in the Aquilan Empire, a kingdom where airship travel has become the dominant means of transportation, commerce, and war. In the center of the Empire lies a monstrous, never-ending storm called The Expanse.  

In Issue One, the raider Delmonte orchestrates a surprise attack on the key trade outpost, Port Prince. His actions prompt Royal Guard Captain Helen Pierce to volunteer for an expedition to bring him to justice.  

In Issue Two, Captain Pierce enlists the help of the elusive William.  

Issue Three follows the pair as they recruit members for their mission in the bordertown of Copperhead. 

In Issue Four, the crew of the Zephyr comes together despite their differences. 
Issue Five follows the Zephyr as they finally embark on their mission into the Expanse...



Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou have been creating stories together since 2008. They met in college and continue to collaborate despite being 5,437 miles apart.
Pablo Peppino is a an illustrator from Argentina with a focus on sequential art. 
Bryan Valenza is a prolific artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects from top publishers in the industry. 

Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army.    
Josephe Vandel is a German cartographer and graphic designer with a love for RPGs and creating fictional worlds.
 The majority of funds from this Kickstarter will go into covering the cost of printing issue #5 and fulfilling orders from this Kickstarter. Any remaining money will be put back into further production of Skies of Fire. 
Skies of Fire Book I is 8x11" clothbound hardcover with 120 pages including sequentials, codex documents, and variant covers.. The book features a new wraparound cover by Pablo de Bonis featuring the city of Monterey. 
Skies of Fire Book I. Collects the first four issues. 8x11, Clothbound, 120 Pages. Includes past covers and variant documents.
Interior of Book I featuring issue four.
Like our previous single issues, Skies of Fire #5 will be an 8x11 saddle-stitched floppy comic with 38 pages of interiors.  
Skies of Fire single issues are beautiful oversized 8x11 comic books printed.
This issue's featured variant cover features the dark and gothic work of  Gabriela Bacila. 
The illustration will depict the two elder gods, Nihil and Amika, raging against their eternal prison walls that form the Expanse. 
The full variant will be revealed towards the middle of the campaign. 
Collector's Edition Limited Bookplate (numbered out of 1000).
Zephyr Papercraft Model designed by Guardadobosque.
Add-Ons will be handled post campaign by our partners at Backerkit. You will be able to select additional a la carte items for purchase after you confirm your shipping information. Funds in excess of your chosen reward tier can also be used to purchase add-ons in Backerkit. If you have a specific question about an add-on, please don't hesitate to directly message us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our eighth crowdfunding campaign. In every case we've been dedicated to fulfilling what we've promised at all costs. The biggest risk associated with this campaign is a delay on estimated shipping times. We have not yet printed the comics for Issue #5, and in the event of unforeseen circumstances the books may take longer to arrive in our hands.

We're doing our best to decrease the time between campaign end and shipping. In the past we've been as good as fulfilling in under two months - that's our goal for this campaign, and we're confident we can achieve it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hell, it's about time!  https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/raychou/skies-of-fire-6

Hey Everyone,
Today is our scheduled launch day for Skies #6! Unfortunately we're not sure if we'll be able to launch the campaign today. That is because the campaign is still under Kickstarter review.
Our past four campaigns we've been approved instantly as soon as we've hit submit. This time however it looks like we're back in the general queue.

Hey Everyone,
We have to very important announcements today.
New York Comic-Con
Unfortunately, it's with a heavy heart that for the first time in five years we will not be attending New York Comic-Con. New York holds a special in our hearts as it's where Vince and I met and launched our comic careers. This year though there were many extenuating circumstances that made it a difficult time to travel. Primarily, Ray works mostly weekend for his day jobs and one of his best friends got married this past weekend. Taking into account the already missed week, he needed to make up the difference. We're sorry for anyone disappointed at the news - we are as well. Hopefully we'll be back in New York sooner rather than later as we love the city and our fans there.

Hey Everyone,
 Our Kickstarter for Glow #3 is now live!

Hey Folks!
This is something that makes me very happy:

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Done! - Campaign Close, Glow, and Next Issue!
updates.update_content:
Hey Folks,
Just got word that Vince has started European shipping! All told we have about 200 packages left to ship which we'll try to wrap up this week and next. We are waiting on the final print of our Variant covers which were ordered early last week. We're expecting to receive them this Wednesday at which point I'll send them over to the UK along with some other bits and ends of merchandise that we need.

Hey Everyone,
I just set up the digital distribution profiles on BackerKit for the following items: Skies of Fire Digital Collection, Glow Digital Files, Digital Posters, & Digital Prints. 
I also sent out email notifications via BackerKit informing those who received / purchased those rewards that their downloads are ready.

updates.update_userinfo: Digital Files - Comics, Prints, Glow, etc.
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone,
Thank you for being so fastidious with your surveys! We only have 100 left before everyone's responded. I don't think we've ever run a campaign where we've reached 100/100% survey (and by proxy - reward) fulfillment, but we have a chance in this one! 
NA Shipping Underway!

Hey Everyone!
BackerKit surveys are being sent out today! They'll be trickling in throughout the course of the day. Here's a direct link to our project if you rather sign in / fill out the survey that way:
 https://skies-of-fire-1-5.backerkit.com

campaign.story:
Workhouse Games (creators of The Awful Orphanage and The Hollow Earth) present the first Chapter & Verse boxed set of premium resin miniatures based on H.P. Lovecraft's Dreams in the Witch House. This collection of 8 high quality resin miniatures have been designed for RPG gamers, collectors and painters alike and offer a unique and highly detailed take on classic characters from famous literary works. 
Let's meet the cast shall we?
PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

It wouldn't be a Kickstarter without some sparkly additional purchases, and we think we've got a good one for you ... feast your eyes on these ...
Boxed Set of 3 Elder Things
This boxed set includes 3 multi-part resin Elder Things in 3 different poses. This will be available during the Pledge Manager for £50 and will be hand-cast alongside the core Dreams in the Witch House boxed set.
PLAY

Everybody's favourite Old One is all ready for Easter!
Standing at a smidge over 42mm tall, here's Cthulhu with Bunny Ears and Easter Eggs as we all know who really brings the chocolate, and it's not that glory stealing rabbit!
This resin Chibi Cthulhu will be available during the Pledge Manager and will be £20
We have also worked closely with the rather wonderful Veronica Anrathi to create a bespoke Art Print for this boxed set release.  This beautiful A3 print will be printed onto 300gsm recycled board and will be printed here in the UK too. These will be available for £15. All additional purchases will be available during the Pledge Manager which will open shortly after this campaign ends successfully. 
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Workhouse Games and Leodis Games have a handful of successful Kickstarter projects under our collective belts, and through them all we learned countless lessons and are applying all of them to this project too!

All miniatures have been designed, costed and are ready to begin casting upon the funding of this project, so whilst we state August 2019 as a shipping date ... we're being pessimistic with that date and are aiming to have them to you much much sooner!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We have been a little quiet here, and there's good reason ... we've been working relentlessly on getting these miniatures absolutely right. Back when we were discussing creating this miniatures range, top of our list was quality regardless of how much it cost us or how long it took! We've tried and tested countless casters in the UK and only one of them did the trick for us! 
So ... I'm delighted to tell you all that Dreams in the Witch House is shipping!

campaign.story:
(not to scale with each other)
How big? This big.
The Cthulhu: the Harbinger sculpt was a 3D sculpt we made for our Planet Apocalypse board game. We have made the molds and will be producing extra copies of the model for backers of this campaign.
We expect it will take about 3 months to make all the sculptures, and then we can ship them to you. We are putting October 2019 as the estimated arrival time just in case things take longer than expected.
If you are a backer of Planet Apocalypse you can get the art print and promo rules separately (since you may already be getting the statue as part of that project). Go to the pledge manager here and login to add the art print and promos as an add-on if you'd like. 
There are no add-ons or Stretch Goals in this Quickstarter Campaign.
                                                   SHIPPING:
US and Canada shipping will be $10 (all pledge levels)
All other countries and regions will be $15 (all pledge levels)
Typically, import duties are paid up front as part of your shipping costs (which is what “friendly shipping” means), however, there are certain countries where regulations prevent advance payment by a third party, and you may be responsible to pay customs taxes directly. These countries include, but are not limited to the following: Central and South America (including Brazil), Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, Turkey, UAE, Indonesia, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand, and Taiwan. All customers in these locations must handle their own tariffs, and they order at their own risk, not ours. For Brazil in particular, we suggest you have your product shipped to an address of someone you know outside Brazil who plans on travelling there to hand deliver.
You are also responsible for providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This really has no risk, except in the case it doesn't fund. The mold is already made. The rules are already written. This is just a way for us to make the figure available to other interested people, since there have been queries along these lines.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: A little fun teaser and a Final Farewell!
updates.update_content: Hastur Has Risen!
My four daughters chose the following colors (the other green one being held is my personal one - just the normal green).

All,
I am told that Harbinger specifically should be completed - though not necessarily all of Planet Apocalypse (again, for this huge project that was combined with Harbinger, much was split into two shipments). 
If you do NOT have at least tracking for your Harbinger stuff, don't hesitate to contact our support:

All,
Australia and Canada are all out the door (the final Canada orders went out the door this past Monday).
Asia is still on pause due to the health crisis in mainland China. But the fulfillment warehouse is keeping in touch with us - they have the products and data, and are ready to go the moment they are able to (when their employees can return and the government lifts regulations).

All,
I had promised to send an update once I knew orders were actually in the mail (for US, Canada, and/or Europe).
Yesterday 426 orders were picked/packed/processed in the US and have tracking emails sent.

updates.update_userinfo: US, Canada has begun + AU is complete
updates.update_content:
All,
I don't think this will come as too big of a surprise that things are going slower than expected - and it sucks.
Aetherworks has informed me that they were not able to get everything out the door by last Friday as planned, but are still working on the PA orders. Apparently their other projects they have in the pipeline slowed things down a bit, but they do tell me that orders should be wrapping up

updates.update_userinfo: Going a little slower than expected
updates.update_content:
All,
Sorry for my lack of update yesterday - I was ill with a 24 hour bug.
US, Canada, and EU Regions - We're still in massive fulfillment prep of the huge amounts of boxes and SKUs in US, Canada, and EU (I'm holding a bet internally as to who will be ready first - US has more total orders and boxes, but also a bigger team, so we'll see).  AS soon as I get word they are sending actual packages with tracking emails I'll post a KS update - whether it's tomorrow or Sunday or whenever.  I am as desperately antsy as anyone to get these packages in the actual mail!

updates.update_userinfo: Still in Fulfillment Prep for US, Canada, EU; AU all out door by tomorrow; bad news for Asia
updates.update_content:
Once again, Australia is still the luckiest - our shippers have indicated ALL Australian region backers will have their stuff in the mail by February 7th!
In general, there is no additional news for any other region different than what I wrote last week. They are still organizing the shipping lines for this massive project.
I know, I know.....

updates.update_userinfo: Australia all out the door by the 7th!
updates.update_content:
Australia Shipping Update
Australia has the data, product, everything (as noted last week).  I'd intended to update you on Wednesday as normal, but I hadn't received Australia's estimated timeline from the fulfillment house and I really wanted to post that. I still don't have it yet, but didn't want an entire week to go by so I'm posting anyway - I do know they are beginning the fulfillment process (my assumption is that they don't want to provide an estimate until they've been processing it for a few days).

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Kickstarter page for Miskatonic High #1! 
To quickly find out what our comic is about, you can watch the trailer (it’s right up above). But if you still have questions, we’re here to answer them!
Yes, it’s a comic book with 24 pages filled with chills, humor and a little real-life pathos. 
Well, do you like…
Fun comic books like Sabrina, Saga and Crossed?
Fun movies like Evil Dead 2, The Breakfast Club and Beetlejuice?
Fun TV shows like Stranger Things, The Chilling Adventures of Sabrina and Friday Night Lights?
Then you’ll probably like this comic too! (However, if you don’t like fun, we have a tedious copyright disclaimer written in our best legalese that might be right up your alley!)
Five teens take on H.P. Lovecraft’s monsters and their small-town high school … They’re just not sure which is worse.
Miskatonic High is an ongoing series packed with light horror, tongue-in-cheek humor and the amazing artwork of Ryan Mendoza (who can draw just about anything with a tentacle).
Parental advisory: There’s so many great series for young adults nowadays that you might be fooled into buying this for your five-year-old, but this series is rated PG-13 and more for teens and above.
In the rustic hills of a small New England Berkshire town lies the prestigious Miskatonic High School. When the Community Service Club goes on a field trip, they’ll be launched on a terrifying adventure that will change their lives while birthing an evil into our modern century. 
This is the beginning of the six-issue first season of the new high school horror series Miskatonic High.
We hope so, but here are some unbiased reviews.
Jenn Marshall of Sirens of Sequentials said:
“Miskatonic High is a fun story that balances everything you want in a good horror story. There is some gore, but not so much that you get overwhelmed. The jokes are funny, but they don’t make the story feel like a parody of something else. It was well thought out, and I cannot wait to see where it is going to go next.”
“Artist Ryan Mendoza brings a level of detail to the story that perfectly compliments the writing style. It fits the spooky storytelling by adding shadow to hide monsters, and the detail in the backgrounds make you want to spend time on each panel.” 
“The monsters are very Lovecraftian. … Because they have that Lovecraftian feel to them, the monsters really are both written and drawn in a way that affected my Lizard Brain.” Read the full review
"...so many tentacles..."
The Pullbox called it “the bastard lovechild of John Hughes & H.P. Lovecraft.” (We’re pretty sure they meant that in a metaphorical way, because if that’s literal, well… ewww.) 
Here’s more from Paul’s review: “It brings a mismatched group of high schoolers together, throwing them against evil the likes of which you’d find in a dusty tome full of impossible to pronounce names. The beauty is in the execution. Despite some pretty heavy themes -- mounting madness, eternal torment, human sacrifice -- Mike Shea’s story stays fairly tongue in cheek. [Artist Ryan Mendoza] knows how to get his Lovecraft on. So many tentacles…” Read the full review
Miskatonic High #1-6 will be available as a collected edition and issue 1 has been approved and will soon be available digitally on Comixology. So they think it’s pretty good, too.
Before you back Miskatonic High, check out some of the rewards we have to offer. We offer shipping to anywhere in the world, but shipping costs are separate from the reward costs.

Stretch goals
We've completed two stretch goals and are working on our third:

Help us unlock this reward by sharing this Kickstarter with a friend or classmate who likes fun comics  or Lovecraft-style horror and ask them to give us a try. Just send them  this link: http://kck.st/2VBd3db 
Of course. Here’s the first few pages of Miskatonic High #1 so you can see if you like it.
Stick with us as through the six-issue first season, Alex, Matt, Sarah, Simon and Ren will travel through time to come face to face with Abdul Alhazred and his Necronomicon, descend into the darkest pits under the earth, and learn what is really going on in the public library when no one is looking.
So please join us for the fun!
We’re raising funds to pay for a small print run for our Kickstarter backers and the old one lurking down in the basement. But comics are expensive to make. Printers, the Postal Service and shipping supplies will be taking most of what we raise. Kickstarter takes their percentage, as does payment processing. If anything is left over, we might go nuts on McDonald’s Dollar Menu!
Is that an existential question, because we haven’t gotten that far in AP English Lit yet. 
Yes, there are two guys working hard to bring Miskatonic High to life. The comic was written and lettered by Mike Shea and drawn and colored by Ryan Mendoza. We’d say more about ourselves, but we’re actually really busy putting the finishing touches on issue 6, the last issue in Season 1! 
So you can feel comfortable getting invested in Miskatonic High, because you’re sure to find out the answers to what is really going on!
Additionally, you can follow Miskatonic High on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Plus there's a Miskatonic High website where you can sign up to our mailing list for the latest updates.
Add-ons
We've gotten some questions about add-ons, and they're a little confusing (mainly to us, but it doesn't take much to confuse us), so here's the simple explanation. The only add-ons we have at this time is:
An extra copy of our standard issue 1. Each additional copy costs $5.
An extra copy of our 8.5" x 11" print from the second stretch goal. Each additional print costs $2.
In order to buy them, simply go to the top where it says "Manage your pledge." It'll take you to the level you pledged. In the pledge amount box, just add $5 for each additional copy you want and/or $2 for each additional print.
After the campaign ends, you will receive our survey, which will tell you that you have extra money to “spend” on add-ons. You just need to let us know how many extra issues/prints you want then (according to the tutorial that I found on Google which is hopefully not even older than the box of baking soda in my fridge...wait, I never put a box of baking soda in my fridge!). 
That's simple, right? If you have any additional questions, just let me know.
Attribution
"Hey guys, who did that amazing music in your video?" 
Glad you asked, it's a track called Wizard by Jahzzar, which is available on the Free Music Archive. We edited the track to fit our video.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The cover and pages for the issue are completed and are just waiting to go to print. We have a quote from Ka-Blam, which specializes in on-demand comic printing and fulfillment. The pages will be sent in early February and the issues take approximately a month to print. It will take another week or so for all of the items to ship. You should receive the rewards around the end of March, but we will send out alerts on the schedule as we have them.

So, really, the biggest risk is an aquatic monster dismembering you and dragging you down your drainpipe. But don’t worry, we know the number for a really good reanimator.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: The Hesitating Fear – Donation only
support.descp: Not sure you’re ready for us to scare your socks off? That’s okay, it’s still January and New England is cold! Hopefully we’ll all still be alive when you’re ready.

support.title: The Colour Out of Your Screen
support.descp:
Instant access as soon as the campaign is funded. Just don’t blame us when you throw your tablet down in terror!
INCLUDES:
Digital issue

support.title: The Thing on Your Doorstep
support.descp:
Slip the Kickstarter-exclusive print copy into your favorite ancient tome and everyone will think you’re incanting (you might have to pretend your laughs are just something possessing your soul).
INCLUDES:
Print issue

support.title: At the Combination of Madness
support.descp:
Both the print copy and the PDF? Insane! But you will have the digital backup in case your mom accidentally throws away the comic with the rest of the magazines under your bed.
INCLUDES:
Print issue
Digital issue

support.title: Herbert West: Contributor
support.descp:
Impress all your friends and classmates with your name listed in a special thank you section in your print and digital copy of issue 1! And if they’re not impressed by that, they’re sure to be impressed by the personalized mini replica Miskatonic High diploma you’ll receive to go with it!
INCLUDES:
Your name in a special thank you section
Personalized Miskatonic High diploma
Print issue
Digital issue

support.title: The Horror at Two Books
support.descp:
Look out, we're going to scare you twice! Get two copies of Miskatonic High #1

campaign.story:
If you, or the one(s) you love, appreciate photography, art, design, travel, and quality found in limited quantities, this is the perfect gift. Buy one, a set of three, or the full set of 12. 
This is a fine-art letterpress print adorned with a beautiful love quote from Romeo and Juliet: “Love goes toward love….” The photo is printed using the highest quality, archival process. Hand-signed and hand-numbered in an edition of only 100. If you are looking for a unique gift idea to share with that special someone then this will be sure to impress.
Photo of actual final letterpress print with inlaid photo. Hand signed and numbered by Erika Brask and Dan Saal (the photographers).
You get to choose from 12 different photos.
Love is everywhere—if you look for it.
Choose from 12 different photos of heart shapes discovered in the world to be inlaid on your letterpress print.
Nine photos of found heart shapes to choose from.
Three Bonus Photos
As a thank you for getting us over our funding goal we are releasing three new heart photos for you to choose from. Now you are sure to find your favorite from the 12 options. If you can’t decide then get a set of 3, 9, or all 12.
Decorate your home with one of these beautiful prints.
Prints fit any standard 8 x 10 in. frame. (Frame and mat board not included.)
If you get nine you could alternate the prints in a single frame so your wall art always changes. Nine prints would alternate great in a set of three frames too.
Choose your favorite (or get all 12)
We are sharing 12 beautiful photos of heart shapes that we found in the world. Pick your favorites.
Shared Love, No. 1. Together, May 20, 2018, 10:43 AM, Chestnut Street, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA
Shared Love, No. 2. Together, May 16, 2016, 6:08 PM, near Jack London Square, Oakland, California, USA
Shared Love, No. 3, Together, September 29, 2018, 12:17 PM, Lake St. Croix, Hudson, Wisconsin, USA
Shared Love, No. 4, Erika to Danny, November 17, 2016, 12:44 PM, Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA
Shared Love, No. 5. Erika to Danny, July 9, 2016, 3:02 PM, Glennon Heights, Lakewood, Colorado, USA
Shared Love, No. 6. Together, November 10, 2017, 6:50 PM, Barbette restaurant, Uptown Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA
Shared Love, No. 7. Erika to Danny, June 1, 2018, 7:00 PM, Lake & Irving restaurant, Uptown Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA
Shared Love, No. 8. Together, June 27, 2016, 11:24 AM, Chinatown in front of Shan Dong Restaurant, Oakland, California, USA
Shared Love, No. 9. Dan to Erika, July 9, 2016, 5:52 PM, Bean Hollow State Beach, Pescadero, California, USA
Shared Love, No. 10. Dan to Erika, September 27, 2016, 2:21 PM, Uptown, Minneapolis, Minnesota USA
Shared Love, No. 11. Erika to Dan, May 15, 2018, 6:18 PM, home, Minneapolis, Minnesota USA
Shared Love, No. 12. Dan to Erika, February 23, 2018, 5:14 PM, Humboldt Ave. S, Uptown, Minneapolis, Minnesota USA
When the time comes, you’ll use the numbering system below to select your photo.
Be sure to select which photo you want at the time of your pledge in order to make sure you receive the print in time for Valentine's Day.
Bonus photos to choose from.
We will message you through Kickstarter to confirm your selection. We will also be sending a questionnaire within an hour of the end of the Kickstarter campaign. If you didn’t specify which photo you wanted at the time of purchase then you need to complete the survey and make your photo selection. If we don’t have your selection within 24 hours from the end of the Kickstarter campaign then you will likely not receive your prints by Valentine’s Day.
We have planned the production for the cards and photos very precisely in order to get them completed and delivered in a very short time. Please help us keep our promise by making sure to make your photo selection at the time of your pledge.
(*Delivery in time for Valentine's Day is for shipments within the USA only.)
Benefits offered during Kickstarter:
Choose from nine different photos of heart shapes plus three bonus photos
Early bird discount on orders of three, nine, or twelve
FREE SHIPPING within the USA
Delivery in time for Valentine’s Day, 2019 (USA only)
Be assured your prints will be of the highest museum quality and will last for well over 100 years.
LETTERPRESS SPECS
8 x 10 inches
Letterpress printed on a vintage Heidelberg press
Neenah Paper 100% cotton Crane's Lettra® 110 lb. cover, fluorescent white
Debossed tray for inlaid archival photo print
William Shakespeare quote: "Love goes toward love ..."
Limited Edition of only 100
Signed and hand numbered
Fits any standard 8 x 10 in. frame (frame and mat board not included)
ARCHIVAL PHOTO SPECS
Photo prints are inlaid on the letterpress art print
4.25 x 4.25 inches
Fine art giclée photo print
Museum-grade, 12-color, pigment inks for vibrant color reproduction with exceptional wide gamut
Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Bright White 310 gsm 100% cotton bright white smooth matt finish paper
Archival quality of over 100 years
Some notes about our printing processes
The Art of Letterpress Printing: For those who don’t know, letterpress printing was the normal form of printing text from its invention by Johannes Gutenberg in the mid-15th century until the 19th century and remained in wide use for books and other uses until the second half of the 20th century. More recently, letterpress printing has seen a revival in an artisanal form and is used for the fine art printing of books, greeting cards, posters, and other artistic purposes. Its distinguishing characteristic is creating a deep impression of the type and image when printed on soft cotton paper.
Letterpress printing creates a deep impression when printed on soft cotton paper.
Inlaid photo prints: Letterpress printing doesn’t allow for reproducing high-quality photographic images so we inlaid a photo on top of the letterpress print. This allows us to produce an archival quality photographic art print while maintaining the luxurious feel of letterpress printing on 100% cotton paper.
Left image shows the letterpress print before the photo is added. The right image is the final product.
MORE INFORMATION
A note about the photos
Some of you may be wondering whether we retouched some of these photos to make the hearts. Some seem too perfect, don't they? That's the beauty—when you start doing this you start seeing hearts everywhere and some of them are pretty amazing. To date we've taken over 1,200 of these heart photos and there's bound to be some pretty perfect hearts in that many photos. So, while we did some color correction, cropping, and even a little sharpening on some to make the photos look the best possible, we can honestly say that we never did any photo-retouching (or "Photoshopping") to alter the heart shapes in any way. We also made a pledge to each other — and to you — that we do not purposely make hearts, stage them, or alter the hearts before we take the photos. The photos are exactly as we found them. Start looking, and see for yourself. Once you start, it's easy to find them.
International Shipping
We are happy to offer this special gift to everyone in the world. Unfortunately, anyone outside the USA will not get their cards by Valentine’s Day. The cards are a great gift for any occasion though and international customers can expect delivery by the end of February. Because of the high costs of international shipping we have to charge our international customers to cover the costs. We appreciate your understanding.
In some countries, customs duties may be applied to print shipments. If this is the case then you will be charged for these additional fees. We have no way of knowing if these charges will be incurred or how much they might be.
International supporters who receive tracking numbers should track their packages very closely. Shipments may get stalled in customs and you will have no way of knowing this unless you keep tracking your package. You need to contact the shipping agency to resolve any hold ups. If you don't catch it in time the shipment may get shipped back to us.
Schedule
Printing will begin once the funding goal is met in order to get things moving well before the Kickstarter ends. Help us start production early by pledging early.
Jan. 28, 3:00 PM CST — Kickstarter ends
Jan. 28, 3:30 PM CST — Questionnaires get sent
Jan. 29, 3:30 PM CST — Questionnaire must be answered if you want to receive your prints by Valentine’s Day (USA deliveries only)
Feb. 5 & 6 — All orders get shipped out via USPS Priority Mail with tracking (1–3 day delivery within the USA, 6–10 days international). The closer to Minneapolis you live the sooner you will receive your package. We will ship the furthest packages on the first day in order to give them a head start.
Collaborators
Letterpress Printer: Angel Bomb specializes in the fine art of letterpress printing using three vintage Heidelberg presses and a Vandercook proof press. They create fine art books, greeting cards, and limited edition prints as well as work for clients. They are currently working on their largest book project yet which will launch via Kickstarter in 2019.
Fine Art Giclée Printer: Arts District Imageworks is a fine art scanning and print studio located in northeast Minneapolis. They work with established and emerging artists, photographers, institutions, and individuals. They use the finest materials and equipment to ensure highest quality fine art prints and flawless digital files. With over 40 years of experience their goal is to produce beautiful fine art prints, delivering exceptional quality with outstanding service.
Eco-Friendly Shipping
Where we can, we are using recycled materials in all our shipping supplies. All the paper packaging materials are made from recycled materials and we encourage you to recycle them. We looked into eco-friendly plastic sleeves for the art print but we couldn't find any that were archival. You can be assured that your print is safe to store in the archival sleeve until you are ready to frame it. Please reuse the sleeve after you are done storing your print. We are currently looking into carbon free shipping to offset the environmental impact of shipping the rewards to all our supporters.
Copyright
We've put large images of the photos here without protective watermarks because we wanted to let you experience the full impact of them without the distraction of ugly watermarks. Please don't use these images without permission.
Copyright © 2019 Wonderfull Design. All rights reserved.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Wonderfull Design is a professional design company with two decades of experience delivering all kinds of print projects on deadline. We have also managed one successful Kickstarter book project and been the design team for several other highly successful Kickstarter projects. 

We know the timeframe to print the products and deliver them before Valentine's Day is very tight. We have done significant planning to make sure everything goes smoothly. We have all of our printers and suppliers lined up and ready to fire up the presses the minute we are funded.

We are confident we will deliver what we promise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The legendary Green Lantern Emerald Twilight creative team of writer Ron Marz and artist Darryl Banks join forces again to tell a story of World War 2 heroism and adventure in HARKEN'S RAIDERS. The project also includes the first collection of Darryl Banks' artwork, BLACK BOOK: THE ART OF DARRYL BANKS!
Harken's Raiders and Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks
Famed for creating Green Lantern Kyle Rayner, writer Ron Marz and artist Darryl Banks are again teaming for a tale of heroes facing long odds and implacable enemies. Measuring roughly 9x13 inches HARKEN'S RAIDERS is a 64-page hardcover classic World War 2 adventure created by Army vet Allen Cordrey, as Captain Harken leads a crack Special Operations Executive team of American commandos behind enemy lines. The mission: retrieve a German scientist who holds the key to stopping the Nazi war machine, and safely escort him to England. The problem: everything goes wrong, and Harken's men find themselves in the fight of their lives!
Offered along with HARKEN'S RAIDERS is the first career-spanning art collection from comics master Darryl Banks. BLACK BOOK: THE ART OF DARRYL BANKS contains more than 100 pages of artwork and commentary culled from Darryl's files. Measuring roughly 8.5x11 inches, the hardcover volume features classic comic images, sequential pages, private commissions, and much more, most of it never published before. This the next volume in the ongoing Black Book Series by Ominous Press. 
Masterminded by Prime Minister Winston Churchill in 1940, the Special Operations Executive branch conducted espionage, sabotage and reconnaissance missions in occupied Europe. Captain James Harken, on loan from the U.S. military, has assembled a team of American operatives to execute sensitive missions behind enemy lines.
This mission, retrieving a valuable German scientist in Finland and bringing him and his secrets to England, is supposed to be an easy in-and-out affair. But when their transport is attacked by German fighters and their airdrop is compromised, their milk run turns decidedly sour.
Harken's team must not only engage the enemy, but also race against the clock to get to the extraction point. And the very fate of the war effort may depend upon their success!
Harken's Raiders Pages 1-7, created by Allen Cordrey, Ron Marz, and Darryl Banks
Acclaimed artist Darryl Banks is most closely associated with his creation Kyle Rayner, who took over the mantle of Green Lantern following the landmark "Emerald Twilight" storyline. Staying with the title for nearly a decade, Darryl left an indelible mark on the iconic franchise. But Darryl's career has spanned a multitude of comics publishers, as well as commercial projects and private commissions. Now, for the first time, an expansive array of Darryl's work is being gathered for a career retrospective in BLACK BOOK: THE ART OF DARRYL BANKS. The hardcover volume contains more than 100 pages of rare artwork and commentary. This is the fifth volume in the Ominous Press Black Book Series.
A selection of preview images from Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks
Harken's Raiders S.O.E. Patch and Challenge Coin
We are proud to present the custom designed Harken's Raiders S.O.E patch and challenge coin to our backers, and lovers of memorabilia.  Each is designed to reflect and pay homage to military S.O.E. units like the one emblazoned on the pages of the Harken's Raiders original graphic novel. The patch measure 4" in diameter and the challenge coin is sized at a gorgeous 1.5".The challenge coin features a special unofficial member of the Harken's team, Alfie, because what's a World War 2 story without a bulldog? Both the S.O.E. patch and challenge coin can be pledged for in the Care Package reward tier as well as others. Additionally, both will be featured as add-ons and can be added to your pledge via BackerKit after the campaign ends, or at any time during the campaign.
Harken's Raiders S.O.E. Patch and Challenge Coin
 Amrit Birdi Variant Cover
Renowned Assassin's Creed cover artist and artist of the explosive Username graphic novel series, Amrit Birdi, has created this exclusive Harken's Raiders variant cover for our Kickstarter backers. Gorgeously illustrated on toned paper, this variant is in limited supply, so be sure to claim your copy before it's too late!
Harken's Raiders Variant Cover by Amrit Birdi
Craig Cermak Variant Cover
Perhaps best known for his work on Red Team with legendary writer Garth Ennis, Craig has illustrated a host of classic characters including Elvira, Voltron, and the incomparable Bettie Page. An homage to Mike Zeck’s classic Punisher cover, this variant can be claimed for a pledge of $45. But act fast, as supplies are limited to just 100 copies!
Harken's Raiders Variant Cover by Craig Cermak
Ron Marz Ominous Press Combo
A little something special for fans of Ron Marz. Backers who pledge at this $50 or more level will get physical copies of both Harken’s Raiders AND the recently released oversized graphic novel Beasts of the Black Hand created by Paul Harding, penned by Ron Marz, and illustrated by Matthew Dow Smith.
Beasts of the Black Hand and Harken's Raiders Written by Ron Marz
Ron Marz Ominous Press Trio
Love Ominous Press and Ron Marz? Missed out on our previous Kickstarter campaigns? No problem! Backers who pledge at this $75 or more level will get physical copies of Harken’s Raiders, Ominous Press’s Demi-God created by Bart Sears, penned by Ron Marz and illustrated by Andy Smith AND the recently released oversized graphic novel Beasts of the Black Hand created by Paul Harding, penned by Ron Marz, and illustrated by Matthew Dow Smith. Get them all at once and save a few bucks!
Darryl Banks Print Set
For the art lovers among you! For a pledge of $95 or more, you’ll get a set of FIVE masterful prints created by Darryl Banks featuring his creations Parallax and Kyle Rayner. Also included are a digital copy of the Harken’s Raiders original graphic novel as well as physical copies of both Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks and Harken’s Raiders. 
Darryl Banks Print Set
"Black Book: The Art of" Collection
The ultimate art lover’s reward! Backers who pledge $100 or more will receive physical copies of Ominous Press’s entire “Black Book” collection including Black Book: The Art of Bart Sears, Black Book: The Art of Andy Smith, Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin, Black Book: The art of Graham Nolan, and Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks. As the series continues this is the quickest way to own them all!
The Black Book Collection by Ominous Press
 Ron Marz Silver Surfer #75
For a pledge of $125 or more, you can own a stellar collectors copy of Ron Marz’s classic cosmic Silver Surfer #75 signed by creative team Ron Marz and Ron Lim! As an extra bonus, your signed books will come complete in a Vault System featuring the industry’s first re-openable case provided by our partners at Sleeping Giant. Backers who pledge at also receive physical copies of both Harken’s Raiders and Black Book:The Art of Darryl Banks! Limited to 25 copies!
Silver Surfer #75 Signed by Ron Marz and Ron Lim!
The Emerald Twilight Bundle
The perfect reward for any Green Lantern fan! This is your chance to get your hands on pristine collectors copies of classic Green Lantern issues #49, #50, and #51 signed by The Emerald Twilight creative duo Ron Marz and Darryl Banks. As an extra bonus, your signed books will come complete in a Vault System featuring the industry’s first re-openable case provided by our partners at Sleeping Giant. Backers who pledge at this level will also receive physical copies of both Harken’s Raiders and Black Book:The Art of Darryl Banks. Limited to 25 sets!
Green Lantern Issues 49,50, and 51 signed by Ron Marz and Darryl Banks
 Darryl Banks Original Sketches
It’s time to score some original artwork by the legend, Darryl Banks. For a pledge of $250, 10 lucky backers will own a one-of-a-kind original inked sketch of a single character of their choice, by Darryl, measuring 8.5”x11” AND a copy of both the Harken’s Raiders original graphic novel and Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks. Get them while they last!
Darryl Banks Original Sketch Examples
 A Part of the Team
Become a part of the action! For a pledge of $300 or more, four backers will get drawn into the Harken’s Raiders original graphic novel! Backers at this level will also receive hardcover copies of both Harken’s Raiders and Black Book:The Art of Darryl Banks as well as the Harken’s Raiders SOE patch and branded challenge coin.
Example Headshot by Darryl Banks
Darryl Banks "Drawn-In" Page
For a pledge of $500 or more, ONE lucky backer will have themselves drawn into Harken’s Raiders AND they’ll get the original page to boot! Of course, this backer will also get physical copies of both Harken’s Raiders and Black Book:The Art of Darryl Banks. They’ll also receive the Harken’s Raiders SOE patch and branded challenge coin.
Harken's Raiders Original Inked Cover
Available now is the original Harken’s Raiders inked cover by Darryl Banks! Measuring a full 11 inches by 17 inches, the Harken’s Raiders cover can be claimed for a pledge of $1,000 or more, and of course comes with physical copies of Harken’s Raiders and Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks, as well as the Darryl Banks Print Set and the Harken’s Raiders official S.O.E. Patch and Challenge Coin!
Harken's Raiders Original Inked Cover by Darryl Banks
Ron Marz Writes Your Script
A truly unique offering! Legendary comics scribe Ron Marz will write a comic script of your choosing, working from your outline, up to 20 story pages. For a pledge of $2,000, Ron Marz will bring his decades of comics experience to bear on your story, working closely with the backer to bring their storyline to fruition. One revision pass is included in the reward. Note that no artwork is included in this reward. This level also includes physical copies of both Harken’s Raiders and Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks.
Darryl Banks Original Cover Commission
This is the chance of a lifetime! Have the cover to your comic illustrated by master comic artist Darryl Banks! A pledge of $2,500 secures Darryl's services to draw a cover of your choice, and includes the original, 11-by-17 inked art! You will, of course, also receive physical copies of both Harken’s Raiders and Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks.
Darryl Banks Example Cover
Harken's Raiders Pin-up Gallery
The Harken’s Raiders Pin-up Gallery will come standard in every digital and physical copy of Harken’s Raiders at no extra cost. It includes pin-ups by renowned artists Jennifer L Meyer, Richard Clark, David Delanty, Matthew Waite,  Jeff Johnson, and Peter Krause!
Harken's Raiders Pin-Up Gallery
Stretch Goals!
Upon reaching $20K, we unlock an exclusive eight-page backup story starring Alfie the bulldog in his own heroic adventure! Writer Ron Marz, colorist Ross Hughes, and letterer Buddy Beaudoin will be joined by Avengers artist (and dog lover!) Sean Izaakse! The eight-page story will be included in both the hardcover and digital editions of Harken’s Raiders if the $20K barrier is surpassed. 
 Allen Cordrey is an Army veteran, publisher at Vanbreed Studios, and the creator of Harken’s Raiders. 
Writer Ron Marz has long, acclaimed runs on Silver Surfer, Green Lantern, and Witchblade, among others, to his credit, and co-created Green Lantern Kyle Rayner. 
Darryl Banks has been a professional illustrator for three decades, leaving his mark on the comics industry with his co-creation of Green Lantern Kyle Rayner. 
Dee Cunniffe is an acclaimed colorist, with credits including Redneck at Skybound, and Her Infernal Descent and Lost City Explorers at Aftershock.
Ross Hughes worked for the space program for a dozen years, then turned to comic coloring, working for publishers including DC, Image, and IDW.
South African artist Sean Izaakse was quickly snapped up by Marvel, where he has drawn Avengers, Thunderbolts, Deadpool, and Champions, among others. 
Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou is an Eisner-nominated writer, letterer, filmmaker, and the creator of the video series Strip Panel Naked and the magazine PanelxPanel. 
Craig Cermak is a Kubert School graduate, with comic credits including Red Team and Voltron Year One, as well as a wide array of covers. 
London-based Amrit Birdi is a highly sought-after illustrator of graphic novels, games, storyboards, commercial art, and concept art for television and film. 
Buddy Beaudoin is Project Coordinator for Ominous Press/Sleeping Giant, as well a letterer and designer. 
Sean HusVar is CEO of Sleeping Giant and Publisher of Ominous Press, an entrepreneur, photographer, and creator.

Add-Ons: We are happy to assist with any add-ons through an over-pledge. Email us to let us know what you would like to add, and we will accommodate your request as best as possible. Please email us at info@ominouspress.com for add-on requests!
International Shipping: When ordering from outside the United States, we can combine shipping for you to get the best rate possible.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The vast majority of work on Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks and Harken's Raiders is already complete. Most of the art is in hand, meaning that only the editing, production, and printing phases of the project remain. Editing and production are already in process, and are expected to be complete shortly after the Kickstarter campaign ends.

Assuming we are successfully funded, both books will be sent to press shortly after the campaign's conclusion. Proofing, printing, and shipping to our offices will take a few weeks, and then fulfillment can begin. Delays due to unforeseen circumstances are always possible, but we anticipate a smooth process and on-time delivery.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
The Black Hand is closing! We have only a few days left for BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND Volume 2 on Kickstarter campaign! BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND Volume 2: The Viking League is deluxe, hardcover graphic novel by the original creative team of Paul Harding, Ron Marz, and Matthew Dow Smith, an exciting horror espionage saga!
https://bit.ly/beastsoftheblackhand

We hope this finds you well in these uncertain times. We here at Ominous Press and Creation.Ink are continuing to create, and we wanted to let you know about our latest project.
Live on Kickstarter right now is the all-new graphic novel BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND Volume 2: The Viking League. Created by sculptor and artist Paul Harding, the dieselpunk horror-adventure is a sequel to the initial BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND graphic novel from Ominous Press and .

Thank you for all your support of Ominous Press and Creation.Ink projects in the past! We literally could not do this without you. We wanted to make you aware of a new Kickstarter campaign we’ve just launched. Demi-God is an over-the-top superhero romp in which a typical slacker inherits the power of the legendary Hercules. Written by Ron Marz and illustrated by Andy Smith, Demi-God is one part Deadpool-inspired romp, one part Thor-style mythic adventure.

The Demi-God collected edition features all four issues of the mini-series, two of which have never been available previously. There’s also a bonus story, a complete cover gallery, and an expansive sketchbook section, all in a 144-page package. If we reach the $7,500 funding goal, collection will be a beautiful, comic-sized softcover. If we exceed the $15,000 goal, the entire package will be upgraded to an oversize hardcover volume!

The campaign can be found here:

We thought you might like a peek at what our shipping facility is looking like this week! Boxes with your rewards are going into the mail, and backers should start receiving them soon. Everything has been packed securely, to minimize any possibility of damage.

Like Santa making a special pre-Christmas visit, a delivery truck bearing gifts arrived at the Ominous Press offices late yesterday. Well, not gifts, exactly … but cases of Harken’s Raiders and Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks hardcovers! The truckload of books was unloaded and stored in our facility, so we can begin prepping copies for fulfillment.

Hello, Raiders! We have a mission report! Today we will deliver your digital download of the Harken’s Raiders graphic novel via email. Your digital copies can be accessed by using the code that is provided. The code can be found in your download instructions. If you do not receive an email, please check your spam folder. For any questions, concerns or comments with your download, please contact us at: info@creation.ink
Physical copies of Harken’s Raiders and Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks are due to be delivered from the printer to our fulfillment facility soon. As soon as both hardcovers are delivered, all rewards will be packed securely, and shipping will commence immediately.

Mission update: Harken’s Raiders Backerkit surveys have been sent out! It’s vitally important that you fill out these surveys. Without the necessary information that these surveys provide, we cannot ship your rewards to you. If you do not receive your survey via email, remember to check your spam folders. If you have any concerns or questions, please email us at: info@creation.ink
All files are final, and at the printer, and will go on the press soon. As soon as the books are printed and shipped to our facility, our team will begin fulfilling orders.

The Harken’s Raiders team will descend upon the Baltimore Comic Con on Oct. 18-20! Held at the Baltimore Convention Center in the inner harbor, and known as a comic con that puts complete emphasis on comics, Baltimore Comic Con has long been a favorite show for fans and pros alike.

updates.update_userinfo: Buttoned Up, and Headed to Print!
updates.update_content:
The hardcover Harken’s Raiders is complete, proofed and will be sent off to the printer by week’s end, along with Black Book: The Art of Darryl Banks. It’s been a long road, longer than we anticipated, but we’ve taken great care with every element to make both books as perfect as we can make them.
Here’s a peek at the front and back covers of the hardcover Harken’s Raiders, before some changes to the details.

It's been a long road, but all the art for Harken's Raiders has been completed! We are so appreciative of your patience as the amazing Sean Izaakse finished the art for his Alfie backup story, written by Ron Marz. As the new artist on Fantastic Four, Sean had to pull double duty to keep up with all his deadlines, but we think you'll agree it was worth the wait. The story looks amazing, as does the work of Darryl Banks on the lead feature.

campaign.story:
The Tutorials Book
How to THINK when you DRAW will be a 200 page full colour hardback book measuring 8.5" by 8.5". The book collects together MASSES of my drawing tutorials, covering an enormous range of subjects. The series is EXTREMELY user-friendly, designed to benefit every skill level, from the absolute beginner to the seasoned professional. The tutorials are better seen than described, so GO HERE for 100 FREE TUTORIALS.
The NEW 600 Page Sketchbook
The Deluxe Collection Part 3 will be a 600 page softcover black and white book measuring 8.5" by 8.5". The artwork will be divided into chapters themed around character design, pose and gesture sheets, monsters, robots, concept vehicles, environment design, world building and much more.
The Art of Stranski reprint
The Art of Stranski is a 100 page full colour hardback book measuring 12" by 8.5". The original book raised £40,000 on Kickstarter last year and immediately sold out. We're offering you another chance to get it. To learn all about the book, just visit THE ORIGINAL STRANSKI CAMPAIGN HERE.
Shipping costs for customers outside the UK
For UK customers postage is FREE, but if you live outside the UK you'll need to add a shipping cost when you pledge, as detailed in the boxes on the right. I'm sorry it's expensive, but these books are HEAVY (especially the sketchbooks).
Sketchbooks 1 & 2
In the higher tiers you can get my two 600 page Deluxe Collection Sketchbooks at a lower price than normal. These books are softback black and white MONSTERS, filled to the brim with thousands of my designs, concepts and illustrations. To sample the work in these books just check out THE ORIGINAL SKETCHBOOKS CAMPAIGN HERE.
A huge thank you for taking the time to watch the video and check out the campaign, you can find out more about me and my work HERE.
Now just scroll down to choose your rewards...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've had a great deal of experience with both publishers and printers from working on the many books I've written and illustrated. I've designed and produced books for large publishing houses such as Random House, and also successfully self published many ambitious projects, including three campaigns on Kickstarter, which collectively raised £60,000, and were all completely delivered on time.

All the artwork for the HOW TO THINK WHEN YOU DRAW book and THE DELUXE COLLECTION PART 3 is finished, and the books are completely laid up. I already have proof copies, so once the campaign ends we can put the books right into production. Then it's just a case of sketching, signing and prepping up all the packages in good time ready to ship to you in August.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The UK's MOST SUCCESSFUL comics KICKSTARTER of ALL time, COMPLETELY fulfilled ON TIME.
updates.update_content:
Well, here we are at the final update on this record-breaking campaign - all the surveys have been sent out over the past 3 months, and every single package (if you've filled in your survey!*) has now been sent, meaning everyone will have their books by the end of September, as promised. In fact, the vast majority of you have them already.
7,500 copies were signed, 450 pieces of original art now have new homes, I processed through 10 TONNES of books, and sent out more than separate packages to over different countries. for bringing this thing to life, without you it would not exist, and an extra thank you to who helped me out in the crazy first month of sending all those tier one packages (he got so he could bag and box a book in under ).

updates.update_userinfo: Going into production: The Fulfilment Schedule.
updates.update_content:
Hey guys, I'm back to tell you how the production schedule will run from here until September. I know that many of you have never backed a Kickstarter before, so I'm going to go into quite a bit of detail around how its going to work.
I'll be receiving the funds from Kickstarter in the next couple of weeks, at which point I'll send the 7,600+ books to print , and I'll order the 3D glasses (for Stranski tiers) and all the packaging etc from the manufacturers. Once it all arrives here at the studio I'll begin sending out the "surveys" (which will come to you via email from Kickstarter - it's basically a form asking for your delivery addresses etc).

updates.update_userinfo: £243K ($343,000), 24,000% funded, the UK's MOST SUCCESSFUL COMICS KICKSTARTER of ALL TIME. THANK YOU!
updates.update_content: Guys, you took this crazy free tutorial project of mine and turned it into a £243,000 kickstarter, I am so SO grateful for the support and love you've all shown me through this campaign, it is MASSIVELY appreciated. You have no idea how wonderful this has been to watch unfold, and what it means in terms of how much more free online content I can now put out each week. What an amazing community of kind, generous and inspiring creators you all are.

updates.update_userinfo: £200K (well over a QUARTER OF A MILLION DOLLARS). Thank you ALL!
updates.update_content:
This morning the Kickstarter passed £200K (well over a quarter of a million dollars), so THANK YOU ALL.
I wanted to take this moment to say that if you're a struggling artist, and money's tight, then please know that you DON'T NEED TO BACK THIS CAMPAIGN TO SKILL UP. Nor do you need to pay for expensive subscription or paywall services, or online courses. Just keep it tuned to The Etherington Brothers, and we're going keep on delivering MASSES of tutorials on you're ever going to need to know about drawing and writing (and some stuff that you may indeed need to know!), week in, week out.

updates.update_userinfo: We're now in the TOP 25 MOST FUNDED comics projects of ALL-TIME after just 2 WEEKS.
updates.update_content:
Guys, thank you all so much, you've bumped this project into the TOP 25 MOST FUNDED comics projects of ALL-TIME on Kickstarter! 
Thank you so much for all the wonderful comments and incredibly generous sharing and shouting out about the campaign you've been doing, it is so so appreciated. We're posting up multiple FREE tutorials EVERY DAY on the blog and social media at the moment, hope you guys are enjoying them :)

We passed £100K ($140,000) last night, and I just wanted to drop in and say a HUGE thank you to you all for pushing this thing so high in just seven days. The support you guys are giving this project is wonderful, thank you all SO MUCH.
And huge cheers to those of you that have dropped me a line to tell me that even though you don't have the funds back the campaign, you're sharing it out and spreading the word. That is VERY kind of you!

updates.update_userinfo: We've been trending as the MOST POPULAR LIVE PROJECT on ALL OF KICKSTARTER. Thank you!
updates.update_content:
Hey guys, just wanted to say a MASSIVE thank you to you all for coming on board the campaign.
There is such a wonderful community around these free tutorials. Your kindness in not only backing the project, but also sharing it far and wide with your friends and followers, and taking the time to write me really awesome messages of support has been so, so amazing. Thank you ALL! You guys got this project trending as the MOST POPULAR LIVE PROJECT on ALL of KICKSTARTER, which is just INCREDIBLE.

Format wise, I am largely stuck with the floppy industry, which I'd prefer to be abolished in favor of thicker collections of various production values. Little manga books up to lovely French comic volumes. Just one consumer's tastes to throw into a bucket in the corner. Good luck no matter what you do.

FYI - Received package 1 of 2 yesterday 8/24/18 in Tennessee, US of A. Just in case you wanted to keep mailing data or whatnot. Loving it. I very much enjoy the matte-ness of the paper. I've long felt the shiny magazine paper the comic books largely converted to is actually annoying - too reflective of light, too reactive to body oils, making finger prints, etc. But I really love Stranski, I need this to be a series of some kind. I feel such a Disney/Tintin/Will Eisner/Milt Caniff delicious comic mutant baby that needs to be birthed. Something PG-ish, film noir with more imagination. I feel a potential density of ideas in the art. Thanks.
