campaign.story:
$50,000 Unlocked!: Jeff Easley Dragon art sticker
$40,000 Unlocked!: Jeff Easley Hook Horror art sticker
$35,000 Unlocked!: Jeff Dee art print
$30,000 Unlocked!: Diesel LaForce art print
EYE OF THE BEHOLDER: The Art of Dungeons & Dragons is an exciting new feature-length documentary that explores the history, influence, and stories behind the artwork that helps create the worlds in which we all play. The movie profiles D&D artists (both past and present), former TSR insiders, game designers, authors, and fans. EYE OF THE BEHOLDER: The Art of Dungeons & Dragons is a celebration of the art we all love so much.
Making a movie is never easy, and Team Beholder has spent the last three years traveling the country conducting interviews, and uncovering original art and artifacts from every era of Dungeons & Dragons. To pull it off, we’ve had to dig deep into our own money pouches, and now that we’re in post-production and our adventure is nearing the end, we need your help to finish the documentary and get it out for everyone to enjoy. We are aiming to hold the world premiere at the 2018 GenCon Film Festival in Indianapolis, IN this August.
EYE OF THE BEHOLDER features a stellar cast of artists, game designers, art directors, gamers, and fans, including: Larry Elmore, Jeff Easley, Erol Otus, Brom, Todd Lockwood, Jennell Jaquays, Clyde Caldwell, Jeff Dee, Tony DiTerlizzi, Nick Parkinson, Peggy Cooper, Harry Quinn, Jon Schindehette, Chris Burdett, Margaret Weis, Diesel LaForce, Darlene, Donato Giancola, Ralph Horsley, Matthew Stawicki, Thomas Babbey, Satine Phoenix, Chris Seaman, Brynn Metheney, Steve Prescott, Dawn Murin, Dana Knutson, Laura Roslof, Tim Kask, and many more!
  Watch our second trailer for the film, featuring D&D artists Larry Elmore, Erol Otus, Tony DiTerlizzi, Thomas Babbey, and Donato Giancola, as well as co-creator of Maze Arcana Satine Phoenix and former creative director Jon Schindehette.
  We're absolutely thrilled to offer these six art prints by legendary D&D artists Larry Elmore, Erol Otus, Brom, Todd Lockwood, Jennell Jaquays, and Tony DiTerlizzi!

Get one **personally signed print** of your choice at the $55 Cyclops level - limited to 250 backers. Get ALL SIX signed prints at the $150 Beholder and $175 Purple Worm levels!

The prints will be approximately 8.5 x 11, though they might be a tiny bit bigger or smaller, depending on our options with the printer. They will be a standard size, making them easy to frame. This also makes it easier to ship them safely!

*Unsigned* prints are available for $20 each as add-on's via BackerKit.
Snag these great old-school D&D-style t-shirts with original artwork by Jeff Easley, drawn exclusively for EYE OF THE BEHOLDER. Get your choice of one t-shirt as part of the $55 Hook Horror level, BOTH t-shirts at the $75 Hydra level, and they are available as add-on's for $25 each via BackerKit.
Jeff Easley Shirt A - Hook Horror "Save vs. Hugs"
  Jeff Easley Shirt B - Gelatinous Cube "Old Gamers Never Die..."
Grab the completed film on DVD, including extended artist and insider interviews and peeks behind the scenes, at the $40 Will-O'-Wisp level.
UPDATE 3/13/18! Eye of the Beholder will be available on Blu-ray! Here’s how it’ll work: During the BackerKit stage, if you’ve pledged at the $40 Will-O’-Wisp level or higher, you’ll be able to upgrade your DVD to a Blu-ray for an additional $10. You’ll be billed for this upgrade when you check out. DO NOT ADJUST YOUR PLEDGE! There’s no need. This can all be done once the BackerKit surveys go out.
And, at most levels you'll receive this 4"x4" "Old Gamers Never Die... But Their Characters Do" sticker featuring Jeff Easley's awesome gelatinous cube art!
  We know adventurers love their loot, so as you delve deeper into the dungeon, new rewards will reveal themselves! (We promise, you won't find any traps!)
$30,000: Signed Print By Diesel LaForce! UNLOCKED!
We're adding a print by legendary D&D artist and mapmaker David "Diesel" LaForce to the $150 BEHOLDER tier & the $175 PURPLE WORM tier! That's ALL SEVEN PRINTS at those two tiers! Additionally, donors at the $55 CYCLOPS tier can select this print if they want. UNSIGNED copies of this print, and all the prints, will be available to everyone via Backer Kit. 
Diesel LaForce
$35,000: Signed Print By Jeff Dee! Plus: Digital Copies of the Movie for Everyone at the Will-o'-Wisp Level and Above! UNLOCKED!
We're adding a print by legendary D&D artist and game designer Jeff Dee to the $150 BEHOLDER tier & the $175 PURPLE WORM tier! That's ALL EIGHT PRINTS at those two tiers! Additionally, donors at the $55 CYCLOPS tier can select this print if they want. And ALL TIERS can purchase UNSIGNED copies of this print, and all the prints, via Backer Kit.

Additionally, ALL TIERS from $40 WILL-O'-WISP on up will receive a digital copy of the documentary.
Jeff Dee
$40,000: Jeff Easley Hook Horror Sticker! UNLOCKED!
For our $40,000 stretch goal we’ll be giving folks a ‘Save vs. Hugs’ Jeff Easley Hook Horror art sticker at the $10 level, and the $40 level on up.
 $50,000: Jeff Easley Dragon Sticker! UNLOCKED!
We're happy to announce that the incomparable Jeff Easley agreed to do another exclusive piece of art for us - a classic Easley dragon! He just completed it at Gary Con X. This dragon will be made into a sticker and added to the $40 and up levels.
Jeff Easley with our new Dragon art!
  X-RAY FILMS
Brian Stillman has more than 20 years experience as a professional journalist and filmmaker, working in both the print and documentary worlds. He’s a producer on the Netflix documentary series The Toys That Made Us (The Nacelle Co.), and in 2014, he released the documentary Plastic Galaxy: The Story of Star Wars Toys through his own production company, X-Ray Films. Plastic Galaxy is distributed world-wide by Gravitas, LLC, and is available on Amazon Prime, Hulu, iTunes, and most other digital outlets. Brian has written articles and produced videos for numerous magazines, web sites, and non-profits, including Guitar World (where he was also an associate editor), Future Music, Super 7, the music magazine Revolver (where he was also managing editor), and the New York Post. He is co-editor, with ArtOrder’s John Schindehette, of the upcoming The Owlbear Almanac: The Handbook of the Owlbear Appreciation Society.
CAVEGIRL PRODUCTIONS
Cavegirl Productions, headed by founders Kelley Slagle and Seth Polansky, began producing independent films in 2004, including 13 short films and the award-winning fantasy web series The Broken Continent, which successfully raised over $50,000 on Kickstarter. In 2014, Cavegirl released the award-winning dramedy feature film Of Dice and Men - "a geek movie without the self-loathing" - now available on Amazon Prime.
In 2016, Kelley was named a Docs In Progress Fellow, a selective program for emerging DC-area documentary filmmakers. Seth, a contracts, business and entertainment attorney, is also a sound designer and composer.
BRIAN: I’ve always been fascinated by the art of D&D. As a kid, the art was as important as the game, and I’d spend hours just flipping through the pages and letting the illustrations inspire my own imagination. That love has stayed with me all these years, and the film is an opportunity to share it with the world. I also want to shine a light on all the artists who contributed to the game. Some have gone on to become recognizable names, but many deserve a lot more recognition than they’ve gotten over the years. And finally, this is an opportunity to show how the art goes from concept to creation to publication - it’s an insider’s look at the process that goes into bringing this art to market.
SETH: D&D has, for as long as I can remember, been a part of my life. My oldest, best friends are the people I’ve gamed with throughout the years; some of my fondest memories include spending entire weekends curled up on my parents’ couch just reading through the core books. In the intervening years, I’ve come to realize that the images in those books have become an indelible part of my subconscious. This film is, in many ways, a love letter to my childhood - and an opportunity to share my love of the game and its art with the world.
KELLEY: For the longest time, I was "gamer-adjacent" - and finally became a D&D player (and a miniature painter!) during the making of our feature film OF DICE AND MEN. The art of D&D is key to immersing yourself in these worlds and characters, and I'm thrilled to highlight this work and bring the behind-the-scenes to life!
  With your help, we'll be able to complete post-production, including music composition and licensing, animation, and color correction. We will be able to submit EYE OF THE BEHOLDER to film festivals and gaming, sci-fi, and fantasy conventions. From there, we will seek distribution. Then, world domination! Or at least domination over our gaming tables!
Dungeons & Dragons and related book and property titles, names, and images are the intellectual property of Wizards of the Coast/Hasbro, Inc., or other owners as applicable. This film and associated materials are not authorized, sanctioned, endorsed, approved, or produced by Wizards of the Coast/Hasbro, Inc., etc...  The purpose of this film is to report on, explore, and document the history, development, and influence of the art of TSR, Wizards of the Coast, and Hasbro, and to illustrate the dedication their fans have for their intellectual property. This film and associated materials in no way attempt to assert any ownership of or infringe upon any copyright, trademark, or intellectual property that may be depicted therein.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As the producers behind successful movies and documentaries, as well as a Netflix series and numerous short films, we know what it takes to bring projects like this to completion. We also fully understand the kinds of pitfalls that can get in the way, and how to avoid them. 

Since we are now finishing up the last few interviews and have fully dived into post-production, the risk of not completing this project is extremely low. We've invested three years of planning, research, and traveling for interviews, as well as our own funds, to make sure that EYE OF THE BEHOLDER comes to fruition. Our goal is to premiere the finished film at Gen Con 2018 in August in Indianapolis. We need to have a screener copy finished for submission by April 15th, so we're charging full-steam ahead!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Physical rewards are on their way!
updates.update_content:
We've had our nose to the grindstone for the past few months - the film is mostly done, we're just now waiting to get it back from the color corrector. Once we're satisfied all the T's are crossed and I's dotted, we'll be prepping it for digital delivery. We're currently reviewing the options available to us to get the digital version out to backers and our hope is that will go out in early December.
We'll have a much clearer timeline once the movie comes back from color. At that point we'll be getting out a more complete update with information on the movie, backer rewards, and -- POSSIBLY -- some really awesome news we've been sitting on for a couple of months.

We're thrilled to announce that not only were our screenings a smashing success at Gen Con this past weekend, but we also won Best Documentary in the Gen Con Film Festival!

Now that the mad rush to finish a cut in time for Gen Con is over, we'll now make further tweaks to the film to make it the best it can be, and get to work on our extra content so we can get things into your hands by the end of the year.

updates.update_userinfo: Digital Delivery, Rewards Update, and More!
updates.update_content:
We’re thrilled to announce that a THIRD free screening of Eye of the Beholder: The Art of Dungeons & Dragons has been added to the Gen Con Film Festival lineup! If you are attending Gen Con and couldn’t get tickets to the first two sold-out shows, they’re now available for Sunday, August 5th, at 10:30am. Go to the Gen Con website, log in, and select event FLM18144340. (https://www.gencon.com/events/144340).
-Team Beholder

We sold out our premiere screening at Gen Con on Saturday, August 4th when event registration went live today. But have no fear! If you wanted to catch Eye of the Beholder at Gen Con the film festival has now added a second screening!
The encore screening will be at 11:00am on Sunday, August 5th in the Westin: Chamber room. Search for event ID FLM18143214 at gencon.com/event_finder and snag your free ticket!

We are finalizing our backer surveys as we speak and hope to have them to you early next week. Thanks for your patience!
-Team Beholder

campaign.story:
At the Mountains of Madness was H. P. Lovecraft's first novel that fell into my hands more than two decades ago. The fascination of his reading hooked me up with the author's cosmic horror, leading me, long after, to set up Cthulhu Project, a creative space in homage to Lovecraft.
Elder Thing
This journey led to the development of a board game that we expect to release this year, on the idea of a scientific expedition sent back to the mountains to investigate the events of the story. 
As part of the setting, we have given life to two key creatures of the tale: the Elder Thing and the giant Albino Penguin, which you can get in limited edition through this project of the series Kickstarter make/100.
This is a limited edition, sculpted and hand-painted by Marta Lopez, following our Lovecraft collection.
Elder Thing 
Elder Thing, views
The Elder Things are the most emblematic creatures of At the Mountains of Madness. Scientists from Miskatonik University who ventured into the mountains tried to unfreeze specimens, but the aliens woke up and killed them!
Elder Thing, trapped scientist
In this piece you can appreciate the scientist captured by the Elder, as well as the details of the creature. The figure has a base of 4.3"/11cm, the distance between the wings is 9.1"/23cm, and a height of 6.5"/16.5cm. It is hand-painted and ready for exhibition.
Albino Penguin
Albino Penguin
Giant albino penguins are horrendous creatures imagined by Lovecraft's mind, descendants of archaic penguins bred by the Elder Things. When Antarctica became glaciated, the penguins retreated to a heated underground abyss, although years of evolution in these depths "destroyed their pigmentation and atrophied their eyes to mere useless slits.". 
Albino Penguin
It measures 4"/10cm in diameter at the base, 6"/15cm in height and 7.2"/18.5cm in diameter at the body. It is hand-painted and ready for exhibition.
Albino Penguin details
This project lasts only 14 days so get your reward before it's over! In the upcoming months we will be focused on production tasks of our current projects, so this campaign will only last a few days. Thanks for your support!
Cthulhu models
In this special Make/100 edition, you can also get two new editions of our Cthulhu collection:
Cthulhu Cult
Cthulhu Cult statue
Cthulhu cult statue is 5" x 3.35" x 5.11" - 12.7cm x 8.5cm x 13cm, it was introduced on our Tarot project (currently in production). 
Cthulhu Cult, side view
The Cthulhu Cult model is hand-painted and ready to display
Cthulhu Cult, front view
Cthulhu Idol
Cthulhu Idol
This is our Cthulhu Commemorative Idol created for the HPL 125th Anniversary, now available in a new green relic edition.
Cthulhu Idol
Cthulhu Idol size is 5.7" x 3.3" x 3.7", 14.5cm x 8.5cm x 9.5cm, hand-painted and ready to display. 
Shipping
All the statues are available for international shipping, please choose your reward to check the shipping cost for your country. Part of the real shipping cost is subsidized by Cthulhu Project.
The game
The board game Back to the Mountains of Madness is scheduled for 2018. If you want to be aware of its launch you can sign up for this project without choosing reward and you will be the first to receive information about the project. 
You can also join our newsletter to keep in touch!
About us
The Cthulhu Project has previously produced, with the help of our backers, board games like Cthulhu Crusades or The Writer, and collector's products like Cthulhu Talking Board: Whispers from R'lyeh, The Light of R'lyeh and the Commemorative Idol. We are currently working on production for the Eldritch Tarot and Innsmouth: the lost games. The statuettes for this project have been sculpted and hand-painted by our talented artist Marta López.
At the Mountains of Madness is a novella written by H. P. Lovecraft in 1931, originally serialized in Astounding Stories (1936); it's a work of enormous influence on the horror and science fiction of our era.
All characters are based on the works by H. P. Lovecraft. All our job at Cthulhu Project is a tribute to our favorite writer and all our projects are produced with the support of our backers. 
All pieces are created with a lot of LOVE and MADNESS. Thanks!
campaign.risks:

We have created, produced and sent several products in previous Kickstarter campaigns. We have a certain level of experience in the delicate processes that go from the original idea until production and worldwide delivery, so we don't expect issues: all the models have been sculpted and firsts moulds are ready, so we will start production soon to plan the fulfillment carefully, to deliver at the time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Beasts of the Black Hand is a horror/adventure tale set in the waning days of the first World War, when dieselpunk technology is making for a very different world. The 64-page hardcover graphic novel, created by sculptor Paul Harding, written by Ron Marz, drawn by Matthew Dow Smith, and colored by Neeraj Menon, will debut early in 2018, laying the groundwork for an epic multi-volume story. 
The time is December, 1916. War rages across Europe, some empires collapsing, others being born. In snow-covered St. Petersburg, Russia, the mad monk, Rasputin, is invited to dinner at Moika Palace by Prince Felix Yusupov. Among the dinner guests is a British secret agent named Oswald Rayner. This much is historical fact.
Despite the monk's supernatural might, Rayner succeeds in assassinating Rasputin. But his death only presages far darker events. The secret cabal known as the Black Hand is plotting to unleash otherworldly horrors upon Europe.
It falls to Rayner to stop the Black Hand's insidious plot. But standing in his way is Maria Rasputin, daughter of the mad monk and agent for the Black Hand. Their paths cross with near-fatal results in St. Petersburg...
...and then again in 1919 Paris, as world peace hangs in the balance at the Versailles Conference. Joined by allies like his aide Biffy Dunderdale and American war hero Henry Johnson, Rayner again must face Maria Rasputin, leading to confrontation that yields shocking revelations and deadly consequences. If Oswald Rayner fails, the Beasts will be unleashed.
                                   
  Limited Edition Sculpt hardcover / Art Print by Paul Harding
  Variant Dust Jacket Cover / Art Print by Eric Powell
  Variant Dust Jacket / Art Print by Meghan Hetrick
  Variant Dust Jacket / Art Print by by Mike McKone
  Variant Dust Jacket / Art Print by by Marc A. Nelson
    Vucari bust sculpture by Paul Harding (Final product color may vary)
    Vucari 6" statue by Paul Harding (Final product color may vary)
  Concept sketch of Maria's wolf, Hrodulf, by Paul Harding
  Concept sketch of the Black Hand medallion by Paul Harding
    Best known for his work as a sculptor of statues and action figures for clients including DC Collectibles, Gentle Giant, and Sideshow, Paul Harding is giving full vent to his imagination as the creator and concept artist of Beasts of the Black Hand.
   A veteran of the comics industry, writer Ron Marz has worked for every major publisher, including Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, IDW, and Image. He's penned acclaimed runs on Green Lantern, Silver Surfer, and Witchblade, among others.
  Dual threat Mathew Dow Smith is known as both an artist and writer. As an artist, he has amassed credits at Marvel, DC, IDW and Dark Horse, including Batman and Wonder Woman tales, and lengthy runs on Doctor Who and X-Files.
  A concept artist and colorist, Neeraj Menon has worked for publishers including Image, Dynamite, IDW, Disney India, and Edgar Rice Burroughs, Inc. His unique palette has graced many titles, including The Protectors from AthlitaComics.
  Kana Harding (Page Designer, Video Producer and Animator)
 Ominous Press
Sean HusVar (CEO, Publisher)
Bart Sears (Chief Creative Officer)
Ron Marz (Editor-in-Chief)
Andy Smith (Art Director)
Production & Administrative Team
Sean HusVar (Publisher, Producer)
Chris Scioli (Project Co-Manager)
Jason Spooner (Social Media / Advertising Director)

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/beastsoftheblackhand
Web: www.beastsoftheblackhand.com
Twitter: @beastsblackhand

Contact Us: Click the icon for Ominous Press, and then the Contact button. We are here to make your experience smooth and problem free.
Add-Ons: We are happy to assist with any add-ons through an over-pledge. Email us to let us know what you would like to add, and we will accommodate your request as best as possible.
International Shipping: When ordering from outside the United States, we can combine shipping for you to get the best rate possible.
Your participation is the driving force of this campaign. We very literally cannot do this without you. Our sincere thanks for considering us, and supporting us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The experienced creative and production teams have worked in the comic book, collectibles, and sculpting industries for more than 75 years collectively. 

A portion of this project's production is pre-funded, so we have made made substantial progress, but we need your help to get to the finish line. 

Paul Harding, Ron Marz, Matthew Dow Smith, and Neeraj Menon have been working on the concept design, story, script, artwork, sculpting and production of the graphic novel and 3-D prototypes for the last few months. Approximately 75% of the project's work has been completed. This jump start helps reduce campaign risk significantly. We want to make sure the presentation and product are the best they be for our backers.


Our administrative team, as well as our publishing partner Ominous Press, have been preparing and implementing the Kickstarter campaign, including wide-ranging outreach plans. Ominous Press, Bart Sears, and Sean HusVar will deliver their first successfully-funded Kickstarter campaign, the art instruction book Drawing Powerful Heroes: Brutes & Babes, before the end of the year. 

Paul Harding, Sean HusVar, and everyone on the team understand the trust that it takes for you to back our work. We will do everything we can to complete and ship the project on time. However, there is always a risk that unforeseen circumstances could delay the shipping date for a short time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We here at Ominous Press feel that contacting our backers is a privilege, one we never want to take for granted. But once in a while we reach out to let you know about a great Kickstarter campaign that might be of interest.

Thrilling Adventure Yarns 2021 is a pulp-style prose anthology edited by Robert Greenberger, who wrote the Dreadstar Guidebook that Ominous will soon be publishing. The book features an array of pulp-style short stories spanning genres including fantasy, science fiction, sword and sorcery, detective, Western and more, from an all-star lineup of writers.

Beasts!
30 hours left as these words are being typed and we have made significant progress towards our goal of bringing Beasts Of The Black Hand: The Viking League out of the shadows and into the light!
We started the week at 54% of our funding goal, determined but a tiny bit unsure of how these last few days would go and, 48 hours later, we're juuuuuuuuuuust over 90% funded thanks to all of you that have joined the campaign or increased your pledges. In particular, let's give and a special round of applause for their incredible support of this project. Take a bow, guys, and consider yourself honorary members of the Black Hand!

Beasts!
We made some AMAZING progress towards our funding goal yesterday! It was our best day of the campaign since the first week and if we can keep up this momentum, there's no doubt we're going to crush it over the last leg of this marathon! Thanks to all of you that believe in this project and raised your pledge or liked/shared it on social media. You're making a big difference over these last 51 hours.

updates.update_userinfo: Beasts volume 2: A spotlight on Henry Johnson
updates.update_content: One of storytelling aspects that makes Beasts Of The Black Hand unique is its blend of real world historical figures and dieselpunk horror fiction. One of the integral characters in the Beasts of the Black Hand saga is Henry Johnson, a real-life, American World War I hero.

We’re more than halfway to the goal, but have just one week left on the Beasts of the Black Hand Volume 2 campaign. Now’s the time to put our outreach into overdrive, so we would love for you to share the campaign on your social media. Here’s a handy link for you to use on your social media channels.
https://bit.ly/beastsoftheblackhand

We loved artist Matthew Dow Smith’s cover images for the Volume 1 and Volume 2 hardcovers of Beasts of the Black Hand, so we had him design and draw two more! As part of the current campaign, we’re offering an extremely limited number of sets of comic-format issues #1-#4, which contain the complete Beasts of the Black Hand saga.

Writer Ron Marz sat down with Byron Brewer for a Beasts of the Black Hand interview. You can check out the full interview here:
https://www.dynamicforces.com/htmlfiles/interviews.html?showinterview=IN08032085244
We’re making progress every day on the campaign, but we need your help to push us over the top. Please pledge to make Beasts Volume 2 a reality! Also like, share, and follow on social media, so we can get as many people as possible to the campaign page. As always, thanks for all your support!

10 days to go, that is, Beasts!
We are a week and a half away from the thrilling conclusion to the Beasts vol 2 campaign. It's true what they say: time flies when you're having fun and, if your idea of fun is 24/7 stress and constant brainstorming, you're the kind of person that could potentially enjoy running some Kickstarter campaigns.

We hope this finds you well in these uncertain times. We here at Ominous Press and Creation.Ink are continuing to create, and we wanted to let you know about our latest project.
Live on Kickstarter right now is the all-new graphic novel BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND Volume 2: The Viking League. Created by sculptor and artist Paul Harding, the dieselpunk horror-adventure is a sequel to the initial BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND graphic novel from Ominous Press and .

Backers of our premium boxes, our fulfillment team is working diligently to send you your rewards. Upon doing so, we noticed that many backers may have missed out on selecting a t-shirt size in their initial surveys. As a result, we’ll be sending out new surveys so that we can make sure all of our backers are satisfied with their rewards, and get t-shirts that fit properly.
Please be sure to fill those new surveys out as promptly as possible and we will get your rewards in the mail as quickly as we can.

To string people along and expect them to dish out $30.00 or more for each segment of this story is unrealistic. The value of this is not very good. I suspect with each volume there will be less and less interest. If the story was all put to together in one volume with a price point of $60.00 or less I would still be interested. I was very disappointed in my purchase.

campaign.story:
Since the early 90's, legendary animator Phil Tippett has been crafting an epic homage to the art of stop-motion. 
This is MAD GOD. 
Released in chapters, MAD GOD is gorgeous and grotesque; by turns darkly humorous, and utterly symphonic in its beautiful - often obsessive - attention to detail and to the legacy of hand-crafted animation.
Without Kickstarter, this project could not exist.
As we begin Chapter 3 of this intensely personal project, we once again call upon the kindness and generosity of stop-motion enthusiasts and supporters of independent art all over the world.  We've created an ambitious array of rewards for our Chapter 3 Campaign, in hopes to convey our most sincere  & enthusiastic thanks for backers of every level and interest, whether you're a first-time backer or a supporting member of Team MAD GOD from the moment it emerged from the primordial ooze.
Please consider tossing a few coins in our coffers, to feed and supply  Phil and his army of volunteers as they continue this tremendous - and tremendously beautiful - labor of love.
Now for the goodies -
REWARDS!
MAD GOD 3 Postcards - set of 10 (Postcards shown are from MAD GOD 1 & 2. You will receive new designs from Part 3!)
   MAD GOD Part 3 Blu-Ray/DVD set with bonus features, signed by Phil Tippett (Sets shown are from MAD GOD 1 & 2. You will receive Part 3. )
  MAD GOD 3 Signed & Numbered Art Print (Prints shown are from MAD GOD 1 & 2. You will receive an art print from Part 3. )
  Screen-used Artifact from MAD GOD Part 3. Numbered with a certificate of authenticity, guaranteed with Phil's thumbprint.
  Beautifully mounted tool - such as a paintbrush or carving instrument - used by Phil Tippett in the creation of MAD GOD Part 3. Signed.
  Precise hand-cast replica of Lost Chesspieces, carefully preserved under glass. Limited quantities available (see backer limit), will not be re-cast.
  In this rare photograph, Chesspiece (A) can be seen among the screen-used chesspieces. Chesspiece (B) is obscured by other characters.
  Chesspiece A (Left) Chesspiece B (Right)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The greatest challenge of MAD GOD is funding. Far outside the studio system, and with an unconventional distribution model, MAD GOD would never see the light of day without support from backers like you. 

Do you know how much methacyl & hot glue it takes Phil Tippett to realize his vision of shit-men shambling through a subterranean dystopia?

It's a lot.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: MAD GOD Chessplayer Level
support.descp:
This one's a doozy. Prior to shooting the iconic Holochess Sequence for Star Wars: A New Hope, Phil submitted 10 potential characters from his collection to serve as chess pieces. Only 8 were chosen by George Lucas & acquired for the film. We've located the missing 2 pieces from Phil's career, and will be creating cast replicas of these. At Chessplayer Level, you will receive a replica of Chesspiece (A). To be clear, these pieces are not screen-used, are not part of the official Star Wars canon, and are not licensed or represented as such. These are artifacts from the creative history of Phil Tippett, and are intended as collectibles for enthusiasts of his work and for fans of stop-motion animation.

updates.update_content:
Dear Team MAD GOD, 

We have exciting news to share with you... After more than 30 years in production, and thanks in EVERY WAY to you, the backers of this project over the past decade, Phil has completed the feature length film version of MAD GOD!

To all the Kickstarter backers of MadGod (Part 3):

Some of you have already received the BluRay /DVD.  All are on the way.
If you ordered something with a physical reward and have not gotten a notice with the tracking number, it's possible we're missing info from you (such as address or phone - check your kickstarter messages!)
This is an actual Check Disc for Mad God (Part 3)

updates.update_userinfo: MAD GOD DVDs are Nearly Done
updates.update_content:
Dear MAD GOD Backers,
Delighted to announce MAD GOD (Part 3) has been officially selected to premiere at the prestigious Mill Valley Film Festival next Friday, October 5th.  The film will also screen the following Thursday (October 11) with Phil Tippett in attendance.
Why will Phil not be at the premiere?

campaign.story:
Meet the Goodnewspaper — a quarterly print newspaper that shines a light on the people, ideas and movements that are changing the world for the better, and invites you to join a global community that does the same for others.
We're creating the first year of the Goodnewspaper— four issues that celebrate good news and provide tangible action steps on becoming good news.
2016 was deemed by many to be one of the worst years in a very long time.
2017 isn't off to the best start either.
We’ve experienced collective division, terrorism, fear, manipulation, and injustices. We’ve been left asking questions like, “Are we more divided than we thought? Is it even possible to make the world a better place? Is the world getting worse?”
There are no easy answers to these questions but one thing is for sure: we need hope, maybe now more than ever. We need something that reminds that there is still good in the world, and we can be part of it. We need something like the Goodnewspaper.
The Goodnewspaper is a reminder that there’s good news in the world to be hopeful about, a map for how to move from feeling helpless to taking action, and a tool for those confused on how to get involved in the march against division, terrorism, fear and injustice.
The Goodnewspaper helps you celebrate good news by sharing hopeful stories you might not know about, and helps you become good news by providing tangible action steps on how to make a difference in the world in big and small ways. The stories and tools inside will leave you feeling less overwhelmed, and more capable of being a part of the good in the world. 
The Goodnewspaper's ethos can be easily summed up by a beautiful quote from Mr. Rogers:
We believe that there are helpers even in the most dire of situations.
We believe that the world is filled with good news — we just have to know where to look.
By celebrating the good being done in the world, we deliver a message of hope and change it takes to grow that good. When we do this, we're invited to be a part of the good in the world ourselves.
That's what The Goodnewspaper is all about.
We seek good news. We celebrate good news. And we become good news.
 Each issue will feature:
Good news stories from all over the world.
Profiles of inspiring people who are making a difference.
Simple action steps you can take to be a part of the good in the world.
The Goodnewspaper will also feature cultural recommendations of the most beautiful, hopeful, and thoughtful pieces of media (films, books, music, and podcasts), analyses of hopeful trends that show the ways the world is becoming a better place, and highlights of ethical companies and brands you can feel good supporting.
You won’t feel overwhelmed by the brokenness of the world while you read the Goodnewspaper. You’ll feel refreshed, encouraged, and ready to take on the world.
We need your financial support through Kickstarter so that we’ll be able to:
Actually print and ship something real. (That’s the really expensive part.)
Hire a talented and diverse team of writers and designers to take this to the next level.
Tell compelling, important, and nuanced stories of the good in the world in a time when it feels like we need it most.
Full Color
Printed on 52gsm Recycled Paper (pending printer availability)
Traditional Tabloid
Size: 11.5" x 15" (608mm x 790mm)
Additional Rewards
$80 - Ten copies of our first Goodnewspaper. Great for gifts!
$100 - Take out a classified in our first issue! Plus 2 copies of the first issue!
$150 - Subscription, a Good News Pin, a Good News Tote, and classified!
$200 - Thirty copies of the first edition of the Goodnewspaper. Great for gifts!
$350 - Need some advice or have a question? Get an hour with Branden!
$1000 - Have Branden give a talk at your organization, school or event!
$10000 - Support the Goodnewspaper's growth, and go see Hamilton!
Branden Harvey — Hopeful Storyteller
"Branden Harvey’s uplifting message of hope and dignity is giving the Internet a meaningful dose of medicine. And maybe, down the road, the world will look back on the stories Harvey told and count him among the first in a long line of digital activists." —Mashable
Branden Harvey is a storyteller focused on the good in the world. He's built an online community of 250,000+ incredible followers. Branden has been trusted by dozens of brands to help them tell hopeful and meaningful stories and his work has been written about by dozens of publications.
Branden is the creator of the Goodnewsletter and Sounds Good. The Goodnewsletter is a free weekly email newsletter that shares five hopeful news stories from around the world. (Join for free!) Sounds Good is a weekly podcast featuring hopeful conversations with optimists and world-changers about ideas that matter. (Listen & Subscribe!)
Follow Branden on Instagram, Snapchat, Twitter, and Facebook at @brandenharvey.
Follow Goodnewspaper on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook at @goodgoodgoodco.
Share your good news stories in our private Facebook group!
Get behind-the-scenes photos & updates about the campaign via Kickstarter by backing this campaign.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Designing a physical product and writing content are daunting tasks. Especially at such a great scale. But fortunately Branden has years of experience writing and sharing hopeful stories of good in the world and he’s collaborating with people with even more experience. Our art director has spent years in the editorial world and has designed for artists like Joy Williams, Leagues, and Ben Rector. Our managing editor has been published by Washington Post, the Week, Relevant Magazine, and Huffington Post.

One of the most difficult aspects of any Kickstarter campaign is shipping. We've done countless estimates for the Goodnewspaper and we feel confident that we understand the price structure of each shipment. Knowing this allows us to make sure we don't go into the red while working hard to provide a beautiful and hopeful final product.

Of course it's worth mentioning that the quality of the newspaper (both in terms of aesthetics and content) is of utmost priority to our team. We aim to deliver a high-quality product that makes a meaningful difference in your life. The integrity of the newspaper will always take priority over the shipping schedule if the choice between speed and quality is necessary.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi there! Branden Harvey, founder of the Goodnewspaper here!
A year ago you supported the Goodnewspaper here on Kickstarter. I’m truly so grateful. The world has felt so filled with heartbreak and injustice over the last year, but I’ve felt so encouraged by this community who, like Fred Rogers says, looks for the helpers.
We loved getting to launch the Goodnewspaper on Kickstarter, but the only bummer is that Kickstarter only really allowed people to support 1 year of good news.

Oh my GOODNESS!
We did it! In less than 3 days (52 hours to be exact!) we hit our minimum funding goal. I seriously can’t believe it.
Even though we are DEFINITELY celebrating, we believe we’re just getting started!

campaign.story:
We think everyone can agree, space is pretty cool. We’ve all heard the amazing stories of the first men in space, the men who landed on the moon and the men who’ve lived the longest off the planet. But none of these brave men would have gotten there without the leadership and expertise of some of the most brilliant women most of us have never even heard of.
That’s why we're making “Launch Ladies.” A beautifully illustrated board book for children, introducing them to all the brave, bold women of the space program’s past, present and future. And, for those of us with kids, we're excited to share all the space stories we’ve grown up loving, through a slightly different frame.
We've got an unbelievable list of women spanning from the inception of NASA all the way up to those leading programs that will take us to Mars and beyond. 
To us, this is the important story of women’s courage and brilliance that kids so often don’t hear when we they learn about space. We want to change that.
So this is where we need your help! We’ve gotten a great start. Leila has pulled together an amazing list of women we want to share, Jamey is finalizing the story and layout as we speak, and Lydia has a solid start on a handful of the book’s spreads, but we’ve still got to finish the book AND get it produced.
We have an American manufacturer lined up to print the books for us, but their minimum order is in the thousands, so it’s going to take a hefty amount of time and money to get this project… launched.
We know we can’t be the only ones out there who want to see this book take off. So we’re counting on all you space nerds out there to help us make this happen.
You can check out a few sample pages and other additional information below.
Together, we can make this happen. 
Thank you SO MUCH for your support!
THE BOOK
Book Cover Mock Up
  Margaret Hamilton Spread
  Mae Jemison Spread
  Marleen Martinez Spread
Enamel Pin
This will look spectacular on your jumpsuit.
Enamel Pin Mockup
  Pin Mockup from Supplier
Embroidered Patch
A die cut embroidered patch to iron on your backpack!
Embroidered Patch Mock Up
  Patch Mockup from Supplier
Limited Edition Print
A framable 12x18 high quality print.
12x18 Poster
 Letterpressed Print
We're working with our friends at Angel Bomb Press to get a beautiful letterpressed version of the poster artwork, at an 8x10 sizing. We're working out the details now, so a preview will be coming soon.
Personalized, Signed Book
We'll send you a copy of the book signed by Jamey, Leila & Lydia. Send us your kiddo's name(s) and we'll make sure we leave them a special little note on the inside.
STRETCH GOAL #1 - $11,000
So this thing is really taking off. We're well over 100% funded, so why not keep the party going. If we hit the $11,000 mark, anyone who's backed above the $5 mark will get this fancy little 1" Moon Enamel Pin, made from the artwork on the Margaret Hamilton spread of the book. How lovely!
1" Enamel Moon Pin Mockup
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The hardest part of the project is mostly done. We've got the story, we've got most of the illustrations, heck, we're even getting a digital print prototype with the production house we're planning to use. That being said, we have NOT seen what the books will look like offset print. Proofs won't come until after we place our order. Our assumptions are that they will look better than the digital one-off prototype we have, but we won't know that until well see a proof.

Also timing. We're aiming to get these done by late spring, early summer at the latest, but getting them in our hands, packed and shipped on to you will take between 6-7 weeks from the time we place the order. We're hoping to place the order as soon as funds clear at the end of the campaign, so end of April/beginning of May.

All things considered, having done a digital printed prototype with this production house once before, we're confident it will all go smoothly and we'll have an amazing product in your hands by summer.

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
Now that the donations have been shipped across the country and delivered to various libraries throughout the country, we've got a few boxes of books left.
If you want to grab another copy for a special little kiddo this holiday season, you can use the coupon code "KICKSTART" and take 15% off your order on our website

Hey everyone,
Now that all the orders have shipped and should be delivered, we're starting to coordinate the donations in our respective cities! We've even dropped a few more in the Little Free Libraries around Minneapolis.
Next step will be shipping books our to the friends who're helping donate books in their cities. More on that soon!

Hey everyone! So just about s month ago I got the last of the books shipped out via the US Postal Service. So hopefully you all have your books now and are loving them!
A few got sent back to me as undeliverable, and I’ve messaged you individually about those. So if you haven’t received yours, or if you got a message from me but haven’t responded yet, let me know and we’ll get it sorted out!

updates.update_userinfo: Ok, for really real. Almost done.
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
Sorry for the extreme delay in response here. Wow. I seriously underestimated how much effort was going to go into making all this happen, from a packing & shipping standpoint. I suppose that's what I get for assuming I'd be even remotely productive while a 4 year old and 1 year old run around the house as I try and pack books.

Hey everyone,
So we kinda help off on this news as we were waiting to get everyone's pledges out the door, but since we're coming down the home stretch, we figured what better time to share than now.
A little over a week ago we quietly pushed up LaunchLadiesBook.com where you can snap up the extra books, pins and posters that are left over from the minimum-purchase orders we had to make.

Hey everyone!
Just wanted to pop in again real quick nd give you all an update. Packing and shipping is still moving along at a steady pace. Many of you have gotten your books already, so hooray! For those of you who have NOT yet, just know that we're on the home stretch. We initially had 500+ orders to fill. We're down to 180 orders left and we've been managing to get about 130 orders out a week.

Hey friends,
It's been about a week since we last dropped an update. We've been packing away like little elves over here... and by that, I mean, working at night after the kiddos are in bed getting as many packed as possible.
We're moving as fast as we can, so I thank you all for your patience as we pack and stuff ourselves silly. It's my goal to have everything packed and ready for shipping by the end of next week. The only exception to that is for those of you who ordered personalized copies of the books, those are going to get mailed from here (Minneapolis) out to Lydia in Colorado then down to Leila in Texas then BACK to me to be individually packed and shipped. So those'll take just a hair longer.

Today, our pallet of books arrived! Runey was beyond excited and even tried to carry a case in herself. It didn't go well, but that's another story :)
Started folding boxes last night and packing as many as I could today. I'll start dropping packages in the mail every morning. I'll get them all out to you as fast as I can!
Thanks again for all your support! This is such an exciting moment.
Got home from a quick trip out of town and found a little surprise had been overnighted to my door. A quick email exchange confirmed I'll be receiving a pallet of more next week!

We are only a few weeks left from receiving our shipment of books! In the meantime, picked up the prints from Angel Bomb Press today and wow do they look fantastic.
Thanks so much to Todd and the crew for loving this project as much as we do!

campaign.story:
WE BELIEVE ART HAS THE POWER TO WAKE PEOPLE UP.  
Eight years ago, the artist Shepard Fairey made the iconic image that captured a period of HOPE in America. Today we are in a very different moment, one that requires new images that reject the hate, fear, and open racism that were normalized during the 2016 presidential campaign. So on Inauguration Day, We the People will flood Washington, DC with NEW symbols of hope.
This art has been already been commissioned by the Amplifier Foundation. Some of the greatest activist artists working today, including Shepard, Ernesto Yerena, and Jessica Sabogal, have collaborated with photographers to create a series of images that capture the shared humanity of our diverse America.
Now the tricky part: printing and distributing these images on a massive scale in time for Inauguration. 
Much of Washington will be locked down on Inauguration Day, and in some areas there will be severe restrictions on signs and banners.  But we've figured out a hack.  It's called the newspaper!  On January 20th, if this campaign succeeds, we're going to take out full-page ads in the Washington Post with these images, so that people across the capitol and across the country will be able to carry them into the streets, hang them in windows, or paste them on walls.
Every dollar you put into this campaign will buy six ads printed and distributed for us.
Amplifier will also distribute these images as large placards throughout DC at Metro stops, out the back of moving vans, at drop spots to be announced in the coming week via our social media feeds, and, on January 19, as free downloads for you to print and share as you like.
And for every donation over $5 we will even send a postcard of the art of your choosing to the incoming President after he takes office! (Stay tuned for the text we will use!)  
This art is meant to spark a conversation, and after January 20, our work will continue. What does WE THE PEOPLE—these three famous words in the preamble to the Constitution—mean in the 21st century? Over the next several months, Amplifier will partner with organizations, schools, and everyday families to create spaces across the county, in both red states and blue, where we can speak, listen, and share our answers. Watch for updates on this as the campaign funds and moves into the world!
WHO ARE WE?
SHEPARD FAIREY is one of the most accomplished street artists in the world, and creator and founder of Obey Clothing and Obey Giant, first becoming known for his "Andre The Giant has a Posse" sticker campaign while at the Rhode Island School of Design. He became widely known during the 2008 presidential election for his Barak Obama "Hope" poster. 
JESSICA SABOGAL is a first generation Colombian American muralist. Her art serves as a haven, a tribute, a creative outlet of adoration and exaltation for women with stories often untold. Her pieces possess a vision of female identity that is revolutionary and powerful, brave and beautiful. Most recently she has created a visual campaign entitled, “Women Are Perfect” which attempts to spread this simple but necessary notion worldwide.
ERNESTO YERENA is an artist living in Los Angeles.  His art brings political concerns to light with subject matter that depicts cultural icons, rebels and everyday people voicing their stance against oppression. While Yerena identifies as Chicano he also strongly identifies as Native/Indigenous to this continent which is often seen in his work. Highly recognized for his activism, Yerena is the founder and curator of the Alto Arizona Art campaign (2010) as well as a founding member of the We Are Human campaign (2009).
THE AMPLIFIER FOUNDATION:  Our non-profit is dedicated to amplifying the voices of grassroots movements through art and community engagement. We do this by funding collaborations between those movements and contemporary artists so that their messages can reach a wider audience. Our goal is to flip artists into activists and observers into participants.  
Our work has supported Criminal Justice Reform projects with Cut50.org, Environmental campaigns working with Indigenous groups against the KXL pipeline and in defense of Treaty Rights in the Black Hills, and we have, just this week, commissioned, and started printing and distributing the majority of the art for the Women's March on Washington as an official partner.  
WHY KICKSTARTER?
We are here to find partners as much as funding.  When this message is heard we want them to know it comes direct from the people.  Our goal is 10,000 backers in this Kickstarter and ten times that many participants after Inauguration day. 
THE REWARDS:
 STAY TUNED FOR PHASE 2!
___________________________________________
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No matter what, we have the ability to get tens of thousands of pieces of this art printed to distribute for free in public. We also have guarantees from the silkscreen and offset printers that our product can be made in a timely manner. There is a very, very small chance the Washington Post could reject our ad at the last minute, though we have been talking to their ad department for some time and they know what we are running. If that were to happen, we would buy ad space in other DC papers that day, and we would continue to spread the art beyond Inauguration Day via billboards, bus-shelter ads, etc.
___________________________________________________________________

CREDITS 

/ PHOTOGRAPHERS /

/ ARTISTS /

updates.update_content:
Friends!
It’s been too long! I wanted to get you a final update!
With the exception of those who have not sent us shipping addresses yet, all We The People rewards have officially shipped! In addition, in under three months, you enabled us to give away over a million free prints and downloads in 205 countries, distribute 245,000 print ads in the New York Times, Washington Post, and USA Today, and begin to reshape the national narrative. Our work is only beginning, and we look forward to partnering with you to flip even more artists into activists and observers into participants.

Friends!
Every day truckloads of lithographs, screen prints, and sticker packs are leaving our Los Angeles Hub!
We have 30,000 total packages going out in the next 3 weeks, but rest assured yours is coming soon!!! It may even arrive today!

Friends!!

Thank you so much for your patience on receiving your artwork and for all the support you have shown us over the last month. It is because of each of you we can move forward and continue to create free artwork for these social movements and for all the people marching for our rights!  

This email is to update you on the status of your orders, which are expected to arrive in March.

Friends!   
We hope you've seen the fruits of this campaign, but if you haven't we have updates!  Ive been meaning to send this for days but have been overwhelmed by literally thousands of calls and emails and am just now digging myself out!  
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Friends! 
We have so many pieces of news to share with you!
Last night the campaign you contributed to surpassed the one million dollar mark. This is much more than we could have ever dreamed of, but our goals remain the same: To make a statement of our values on January 20th and then to take that statement and carry it beyond the inauguration into the world. Over the coming year, Amplifier will partner with organizations, schools, and everyday Americans to create spaces across the county, in both red states and blue, where we can share a dialogue about the diverse and dignified America we want our children to inherit.

campaign.story:
Say an awkward hello to: 
THE REAL AMERICAN ZEROES™ (RAZ™)
"NOT AMERICA'S FAVORITE COMICBOOK"™
Retardo: Invulnerable to both physical and emotional pain, plus naturally possesses exaggerated retarded strength. 
V.D.: Ex-pornstar who infects enemies with crippling viruses by squirting STD-laced silicone foam from her botched left breast implant. 
Skid mark: All-around poor personal hygiene is his "power."
Dick: Weakens foes with acid-dipped insults while simultaneously protecting his own feelings from being hurt with a shield of sarcasm. 
(If you think this project description is a hot mess, just wait until you read a full issue of RAZ™.)
I dreamt up a dirty 30 backer rewards (along with a few stretch rewards for the near future) so let's begin shall we? 
Despite the plan to produce an entire f’ing mini-series (5 issues, 24+ pages each), I think you’ll find my financial ask to be quite reasonable in relation: 
1. $5,000 ($1k per issue) for illustrations, inking and coloring. Because I believe artists should be paid at least something upfront for both their time, and more important, talent.
2. $1,000 for marketing. This will involve either a direct mail postcard campaign to virtually every comic book store in America or preferably, a promotion fee (read: wheel-greasing money) paid directly to Diamond Comic Distributors, who will essentially perform a similar type of promotional push, but by telephone calls to comic shop stores and ads placed in "Previews." 
3. $1,000 for printing
4. $1 (because I want to show some profit in order to prove this idea is commercially viable).
STEVE GEIGER explaining to me what it takes to launch a comic title after drawing the next 2 covers of RAZ™ (read: he loves the idea and wants to continue being a part of it)
Firstly, iconic MARVEL artist STEVE GEIGER (Hulk, Punisher, Spider-Man, X-Men, etc.) has already illustrated the covers for the next two Issues (#1 and #2). Both signed rough sketches are available as backer rewards. 
Signed Rough RAZ™ Issue #1 Cover Sketch of FAT SACKS by STEVE GEIGER (original available as backer reward)
  Signed Rough RAZ™ Issue #2 Cover Sketch of EMPTY SUIT by STEVE GEIGER (original available as backer reward)
  RAZ publisher Charles Moisant having a cigarette put out on his ass by this year's Dark History best costume winner and early RAZ™ fan
In addition, I’m partnering with a professional publisher (CHARLES D. MOISANT, founder of SILVERPHOENIX.NET), who is a 25-year industry veteran and proven name in the comic book biz who travels to 40-50 conventions/year.
Preview of The Real American Zeroes™ Issue #0 Page 1
  Preview of The Real American Zeroes Issue #0 Page 2-3 spread
  Preview Page of Issue #0 featuring main villain DIABETTY using her "sugah foot" as a battering ram
Secondly, the first issue (origin story issue #0) which features a neighborhood welfare queen named DIABETTY who uses her diabetic foot as a battering ram, is in the can and ready to download and/or mail. The script for the second issue (featuring a villain named FAT SACKS whose elephantiasis of the testicles represents the living embodiment of corporate greed) is already finished, with an art completion date of mid-November. And I have already begun writing the script for the third issue, which centers on a corrupt politician with an oversize right mitt for handshaking who is literally an EMPTY SUIT. The 4th and 5th issues will feature an overly child-friendly villain who motors around elementary schools districts whose given himself the nickname “UNCLE HOT TUB,” and a pre-emptive "Special Issue" strike against The Special Olympics Committee, respectively.
100+ creative awards and counting (no B.S.)
Next, I’m a professional advertising writer known for my unique brand of edgy irreverence along with east coast wit, with over 100 creative awards to my name as proof of such. As one of the most in-demand freelancers in the country, I don’t miss deadlines and anyone who knows me will tell you I’ve never flaked when it comes to creating things I say I’ll make.
Dark History Oct 21-23 (Urbana, IL) Not only did I sell all 30 of my test copies of RAZ Issue #0, but it was the comic everyone was buzzing about despite the convention's predominantly goth/horror theme.
Lastly, dozens of test copies of Issue #0 have sold at every convention either Charles and/or I have attended over the past couple months. Much to our surprise and delight, RAZ™'s initial fan base has been 50% female, including high schoolers eager for the kind of mature content that requires hiding from their parents but sharing with all their social media savvy friends.
RAZ™'s #3 fan!
  RAZ™'s #4 fan (thank you random paper delivery guy!)
  Corrupting yet another Gen Z mega-fan by explaining life through the warped philosophical lens of The Real American Zeroes™
  It's only appropriate to have a real life porn star sign a copy of the comic that features an ex-porn star superhero who sports a perpetual mushroom bruise (V.D.) Thanks Mia Mae! Available as a backer reward for an apropos $69
  The couple that reads RAZ™ together...apparently starts to look like each other.
  These 3 belong together
  This guy
  Those guys
  (Im)Mature Content - Not For Kids (which is why I sell RAZ™ to anyone over 12 when their parents aren't looking)
  Women love The Real American Zeroes™ just as much as men
© 2009-2016 Outlier Comics, Inc.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
"The greatest risk is not taking one."

The only real challenge I face is whether or not Diamond will agree to distribute this very original brand of underground, irreverent and politically incorrect satirical send-up of the current state of The United States. (If not, we'll just find another distributor or do it ourselves.) Whatever.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.creator_bio:
Colin Kennedy (Corcoran)
First created · 6 backed
Colin has been one of the top freelance copywriters in the country over the past decade for the evil advertising industry. He's the writer...See more

support.descp: Is it a picture of my penis, or is it a picture of Dick’s dick? Or is it simply an Oscar Meyer hot dog? For legal reasons, it will be the hot dog. *all backers (except for $1 broke-asses) will receive their full name credited on the last page of Issue #2

Flag is an app for iOS. You can download a free copy here. 
Anyone using Flag can get 20 free prints made and delivered each month.
Flag's free prints are the best in the world, much higher quality than prints other companies charge for.
Flag delivers prints in any aspect ratio from square to panorama - all free.
Huge demand means Flag can't deliver prints to everyone who wants them. You can buy prints through the app today. If you want Flag's free print service this campaign is the only way to get it.

You can learn more about sending targeted advertising with Flag here.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have done deals with our suppliers to purchase the equipment we need and are already producing prints at scale.

We need to hire staff and secure a location in which to house production. The space we need requires 480v power, specialized air-conditioning and fire suppression along with access for vehicles and load-bearing floors rated to specific standards. All of this must be surveyed before we can install equipment. We currently have a site in mind but haven't signed for it. If we are unable to use it there may be a delay while we find a new location. 

Some of the machines we need are produced overseas and there's also the possibility that delivery may be slower than expected.

We have fulfilled our last Kickstarter with the exception of our Android app which is currently in production. We don't have the resources to build for Android in-house and this is being handled by an American partner company. We expect that app to be complete by December, when we aim to deliver our other rewards for this campaign.

We cannot control the pricing of the hardware we need. It's possible that prices may shift and make it harder for us to buy everything we'd like to if we only raise our minimum goal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I believe they are going to make another Kickstarter, this time with a much lower dollar amount needed to be successful
I hope you are able to relaunch this project at a later date. Good luck to you and kudos for recognizing you need a different plan in place to proceed without wasting your fan's time and money.
What is going on? Why it is cancelled? I can see there is no proper comments posted regarding the cancellation. :(
Is there any way to see order status?
I downloaded the app and logged in just fine. Can we edit within the app or just choose a photo and order? I'm not finding it to be very bare bones.

Paul, when you delete the app and reinstall it, it should come up on the main screen right? Choose instant access purchase prints. You can explore and purchase prints. Do not choose the free print anything option or that email will also be locked into the waiting list screen. Good luck!

Ordered some prints to test out the service! Hopefully they are as good as I'm hoping they will be, really tired of crummy digital prints. :( Would love an ETA or some way to check order status though.

Hey team Flag, just received my second set of photos (I'm a backer from the 1st KS). It took 3 months to arrive but quality is awesome. I actually liked the mat paper from the previous set a little better (but photos were faded), but this set is top notch anyway. The prints are as good as anything you'd get by paying $$$.
I think a simple HTML5 web interface is crucial.
I would also like a web interface. I hadn't realized that it *had* to be through a smartphone. Most of my photos are on my computer, not my phone.

Kyle, I also shoot with a DSLR but I export most of my photos out of Lightroom and into the Photos app on my Mac. From there, they're automatically uploaded to iCloud and back down to my phone. When I export them, I actually drop the file size down to about 600 ppi and I set my largest dimension to 4032, bringing my file size down to about 4 MB, which I think is plenty for a photo 5 x 7 or smaller. I do this because I mostly take pictures of family and friends and I like to have all of my photos with me at all times. My iCloud currently houses a little less than 25,000 photos. I'm not saying this is what you should do, I'm saying this is what I do and Flag's current structure is perfect for people like me.
I feel like you are marketing it all wrong then, you are a "Museum quality print service" you are a smartphone photo printing service.
I will have to think hard about if it is worth it to back the relaunch without basic access to my DSLR photos.

To be clear I want this to succeed, and being an app developer myself, I understand that getting to market is paramount, but that said, placing artificial hurdles between my photos and getting them printed is as good as saying you don't want my business at all.
Also, will you offer integration with photo services like Flickr, Google Photos, etc, so I can access my photo archive directly?
Can you be more specific on these in addition to the lifetime membership? Bit confusing... ;)

I was wondering if you could clarify if the $25 dollars for upgrades in the earlybird discount is a one time credit or if it is a monthly/annual thing? Also what exactly is meant by "enhanced prints"? Thanks guys!
Switzerland is in the middle of Europe - why is shipping 200.- instead of 100.- (although on the map its also marked with the 100.- color???!)
I uninstalled and then reinstalled the app and it worked

Hi! I'm so excited to gain access to Flag. Will there be ads on the backs of member's prints? And is the largest size available the 4x6, excluding panoramas?

Also, @Flag, regarding the 'frames' we can upgrade to either by paying per print or bring a Flagship Member, are these the borders with intricate laser cut designs or are the Star, Heart, Oval, Circle, and all the other shape photos considered 'frames'?
Please clarify.
So if it's free for everybody, what's the $25 backer receive? A service that is normally free?
Also what are the sizes for the monthly prints. Thanks
Thanks!

Thanks! So, I have paid for access as of last night via Kickstarter. Do those of us who have paid for early access get it when the Kickstarter funds, or is that coming earlier? When it funds would make more sense, but figured I'd check.

Hi – curious when do we get the "jump the line" part of the Kickstarter reward? I had reg'd for the normal wait list a ways back and was 1 month from getting in, but it just slid to 4 months randomly today. Guessing we don't get in til December?

campaign.story:
Minnesota Center for Book Arts is proud to announce an exciting addition to its Reference and Creative Library Collection: the S. Helmes and W. Gaglione Rubber Stamp Archive.
By uniting the extensive private collections of Scott Helmes and William “Picasso” Gaglione under one roof, the H/G Archive is one of the largest repositories of rubber stamps and stamp-related materials in the world. Comprised of hundreds of commercial and one-of-a-kind boxed sets and over 70,000 individual stamps spanning a period of 120 years, the H/G Archive is both comprehensive and incredibly diverse. In addition to physical stamps, the collection includes original stamp art, artists’ books, limited edition publications, journals, catalogs, reference materials, correspondence art, assemblings, design specifications, posters, and production materials.  
The mission of the H/G Archive is to preserve historical, rare and unique tools of artistic expression while maintaining their accessibility to artists wishing to incorporate them into their creative practice. It is a living archive where use by artists and researchers is encouraged.
An exhibition in Open Book’s second floor Literary Commons presents just a few examples of the H/G Archive’s holdings. It offers a rudimentary history primer and demonstrates rubber stamp use by contemporary artists. From Dada and Fluxus practitioners to concrete poets and correspondence artists, rubber stamps facilitate creativity through their inherent immediacy and operative flexibility. They allow artists to simultaneously reference and critique a range of topics from banal day-to-day life to long established social institutions. 
The S. Helmes and W. Gaglione Rubber Stamp Archive will officially open to the public in mid-2017 after initial documentation and cataloging has been completed. At that time it will begin fulfilling its mission by providing unique resources for art-making to emerging and established artists; serving as an educational collection that demonstrates history and social change; supporting future exhibitions and workshops; preserving and maintaining a traditional creative practices; and enhancing Minnesota Center for Book Art’s programming.
RUBBER STAMPS: A VERY BRIEF HISTORY
The history of rubber stamps dates to 1851, when Charles Goodyear patented a process that turned the viscous sap of South American rubber trees into the hard red rubber we are familiar with today. He called the process vulcanization, after the Roman god of fire and forge. Soon, dentists across the country had vulcanizing pots in their offices to mold dentures. The first rubber stamps were likely produced in one of these dentist pots.
The earliest sets were sold to businesses for making signs and marking merchandise. They were advertised as cutting-edge technology, replacing hand-lettered signs, stencils and more expensive printing.  
By the 1920s, stamps had moved into the schoolhouse and were being used by teachers to create flashcards and worksheets. These became especially popular during the Depression, when few schools had funds for textbooks. Sets like "The Story Printer" contained not only letters and words, but also shapes, mathematical exercises and images of common objects like tractors and chickens.
Rubber stamps also found their way into children's hands. Beginning in the early 20th Century, youth entertained themselves by stamping scenes with sets of circus animals or trains and ships. There were sets based on early comic book characters, construction equipment and cowboys. Children were also encouraged to become printers through smaller versions of commercial printing outfits. 
Use by artists escalated in the 1960s when pop artists working in New York, such as Ray Johnson, used them in “correspondence art.” These anti-establishment artists wanted to break art out of what they saw as the confines of galleries and museum walls. They sent their visual puns and wordplay through the mail to an international network of like-minded people. They also enjoyed appropriating symbols of authority. Correspondence art grew out of two older traditions: Dada and Fluxus.
Today, rubber stamps are still enjoyed by children and used in businesses. While their popularity in the crafting community has waned, they remain vital, versatile, and efficient tools for artists, writers, poets, and others interested in visual language and popular culture.
ABOUT THE FOUNDERS
SCOTT HELMES  
Scott Helmes is a visual poet who began collecting rubber stamp sets in 1974. His poetry stretches the limits of language, explores the multifaceted concepts of meaning, and encompasses all manners of reading. His work also investigates typographic concepts, printing methods, and alternative letter forms within the modern meaning of communication. Helmes’ poetry is realized through a variety of techniques and materials such as rubber stamps, stencils, and collage. He has exhibited internationally and his work is in the collections of some of the world’s leading institutions, including Minneapolis’ Walker Art Center, New York’s Museum of Modern Art, London’s Victoria & Albert Museum, Paris’ Bibliotheque Nationale de France, and Frankfurt’s Museum für Kunsthandwerk.
WILLIAM “PICASSO” GAGLIONE
An avid collector of all things, William “Picasso” Gaglione was the original owner of Stamp Francisco and has been involved with rubber stamp art and rubber stamp manufacturing for decades. He is currently the co-proprietor of Chicago's Stampland. His artistic influence on the world of rubber stamping has been documented extensively through numerous international exhibitions and publications. As a publisher, he has produced multiple boxed exhibition catalogs and assembling periodicals such as Stampzine. Gaglione has created many aliases and identifications during his long career as a conceptual artist (Picasso, Dadaland, etc.) and he continues to prolifically create and perform as a neo-Dadist, Fluxus practitioner, and correspondence artist.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The primary challenge of this project is also its most exciting strength: it has never been done before. There is no exact model for the initiative, but MCBA has the staff capacity, organizational infrastructure, community relationships, and artistic vision to facilitate the successful planning and implementation of the H/G Archive. In 2015, MCBA celebrated 30 years of service following the completion of major renovations to its studios, gallery, and library – renovations that have made the physical framework of the H/G Archive possible. Governed by a 20-member board representing diversity across culture, gender, age, and LGBTQ orientation, MCBA is artistically robust, well-staffed, and recognized for its ability to execute ambitious artistic and educational programming. Coupled with your support, MCBA is positioned to execute this groundbreaking model for public access to an astounding archive of reference materials, artwork, and creative tools.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
